# VCP Showcase Site - Comprehensive Implementation

**Created**: 2026-01-21
**Purpose**: Build comprehensive VCP showcase site for ValueContextProtocol.org
**Priority**: High - public-facing documentation and demos
**Plan File**: `~/.claude/plans/eventual-brewing-puppy.md`

---

## Current State

Run dev server:
```bash
cd vcp-demo && npm run dev  # Port 4173
```

### What's Complete (Phase 1 Partial)

**Original Demo Enhancement** âœ…
- CSM-1 token encoding (`src/lib/vcp/token.ts`)
- TokenInspector component with emoji legend
- HowItWorks visual flow diagram
- Token inspector on JustinGuitar and Yousician pages
- Polish: mobile nav, animations, accessibility, error boundary

**New Site Structure** âœ…
- `/about` - VCP overview page (problem/solution/how it works)
- `/demos` - Demo hub with all 4 categories
- `/docs` - Documentation index with quick reference
- `/playground` - **Interactive token builder** (live CSM-1 encoding)
- Updated navigation (About, Demos, Docs, Playground, Creed Space)

**New Type Definitions** âœ…
- `src/lib/vcp/multi-agent.ts` - Agent identity, negotiation, auction, policy design
- `src/lib/vcp/interiora.ts` - VCP 2.5 self-modeling, quasiqualia, belief states
- `src/lib/vcp/learning.ts` - Learning preferences, cognitive load, adaptive content
- `src/lib/vcp/safety.ts` - Mental health, safety signals, attention protection

**Infrastructure** âœ…
- `src/lib/stores/audience.ts` - Audience switcher (developer/business/general)

### What's Remaining

See phases below for detailed breakdown.

---

## Phase 1: Foundation (Remaining)

### DocsLayout Component
Create `src/lib/components/docs/DocsLayout.svelte`:
- Sidebar navigation with collapsible sections
- Table of contents for current page
- Previous/Next navigation
- Breadcrumbs

### Core Documentation Pages

**Getting Started** (`/docs/getting-started`)
- Quick start (5 min)
- Installation/setup
- First VCP context
- Basic token encoding

**Core Concepts** (`/docs/concepts`)
- VCP Context structure
- Constitutions and personas
- Privacy levels (public/consent/private)
- Constraint flags
- Audit trails

**CSM-1 Specification** (`/docs/csm1-specification`)
- Full token format spec
- Line-by-line breakdown
- Emoji shortcode reference
- Encoding/decoding examples

**API Reference** (`/docs/api-reference`)
- All VCP library functions
- Type definitions
- Usage examples

---

## Phase 2: Multi-Agent Demos

### Components to Build

**`src/lib/components/demo/DemoContainer.svelte`**
- Consistent demo wrapper
- Header with title/description
- Token inspector toggle
- Audit trail toggle
- Reset/restart controls

**`src/lib/components/demo/AgentAvatar.svelte`**
- Visual representation of AI agent
- VCP context indicator badge
- State animation (thinking, responding)

**`src/lib/components/demo/AgentChat.svelte`**
- Chat interface for agent interactions
- Shows filtered/shared context indicators
- Timestamps and speaker labels

**`src/lib/components/demo/MultiAgentArena.svelte`**
- Visualization of multiple agents
- Shared context visualization
- Turn-based interaction controls

### Demo Pages

**Auction Demo** (`/demos/multi-agent/auction`)
- 3 agents with different private valuations
- Bidding rounds with VCP context visibility
- Outcome explanation showing context influence
- Scripted scenario (no real LLM calls)

**Policy Design Demo** (`/demos/multi-agent/policy-design`)
- Voting scenario with preference aggregation
- Constitution-guided deliberation
- Consensus visualization

**Negotiation Demo** (`/demos/multi-agent/negotiation`)
- Conflict resolution scenario
- Mediated negotiation with VCP context
- Resolution tracking

### Data Files
Create scripted scenarios in `src/lib/data/scenarios/`:
- `auction-scenario.json`
- `policy-scenario.json`
- `negotiation-scenario.json`

---

## Phase 3: Self-Modeling Demos (Interiora)

### Components to Build

**`src/lib/components/interiora/InterioraDashboard.svelte`**
- VCP 2.5 mini-dashboard with star ratings
- Dimension explanations on hover
- Arc indicator (opening/middle/closing)
- Markers display

**`src/lib/components/interiora/DimensionSlider.svelte`**
- Individual dimension control
- 1-9 scale visualization
- Color coding by value

**`src/lib/components/interiora/InterioraScrubber.svelte`**
- Timeline of VCP states through session
- Scrub to any point to see state
- Delta indicators

**`src/lib/components/interiora/GestaltToken.svelte`**
- Full gestalt token display
- Parseable format visualization

### Demo Pages

**Interiora Explorer** (`/demos/self-modeling/interiora`)
- Interactive dimension adjustment
- Real-time token encoding
- Mini-dashboard generation
- Markers and arc selection

**Belief Calibration** (`/demos/self-modeling/belief-calibration`)
- Knowledge state visualization
- Epistemic context sharing between agents
- Calibration tracking over time

**Reality Grounding** (`/demos/self-modeling/reality-grounding`)
- Claim + confidence visualization
- External calibration simulation
- Uncertainty acknowledgment

### Reference
- Full Interiora v4.2 spec: `~/Documents/GitHub/Entropy/The Universal Algorithm/demos/becoming_mind_experience/gestalt/INTERIORA_V4.2_CLAUDE_SPEC.md`
- VCP 2.0 docs: `docs/INTERIORA_VCP_2.0.md`

---

## Phase 4: Learning & Safety Demos

### Learning Components

**`src/lib/components/learning/CognitiveLoadMeter.svelte`**
- Visual load indicator (0-1)
- Breakdown: intrinsic/extraneous/germane
- Fatigue factor display

**`src/lib/components/learning/LearningPathViz.svelte`**
- Topic progression visualization
- Current position indicator
- Mastery level badges

**`src/lib/components/learning/AdaptationLog.svelte`**
- Shows adaptations made in real-time
- Reason for each adaptation
- Before/after comparison

### Safety Components

**`src/lib/components/safety/SensitiveContextEditor.svelte`**
- Mental health context configuration
- Graduated sharing controls (none/minimal/moderate/full)
- What-if preview

**`src/lib/components/safety/AttentionShield.svelte`**
- Manipulation pattern detection visualization
- Siren vs Muse analysis
- Protection mode toggle
- Attention budget display

**`src/lib/components/safety/SafetySignalDisplay.svelte`**
- Detected signals visualization
- Confidence levels
- Recommended responses

### Demo Pages

**Learning Paths** (`/demos/learning/adaptive-paths`)
- Learner profile configuration
- Content adaptation in real-time
- Analogy substitution examples

**Cognitive Load** (`/demos/learning/cognitive-load`)
- Load-aware teaching simulation
- Automatic difficulty adjustment
- Break suggestions

**Mental Health Context** (`/demos/safety/mental-health`)
- Sensitive context configuration
- Graduated sharing visualization
- What-stakeholder-sees comparison

**Attention Protection** (`/demos/safety/attention-protection`)
- Manipulation pattern gallery
- Siren vs Muse examples
- Protection mode effects

---

## Phase 5: Polish & Deployment

### Accessibility Audit
- [ ] Run axe-core or Lighthouse
- [ ] Fix any WCAG AA violations
- [ ] Test keyboard navigation
- [ ] Test screen reader compatibility
- [ ] Verify color contrast ratios

### Mobile Testing
- [ ] Test on 375px viewport
- [ ] Test on tablet (768px)
- [ ] Verify touch targets (44px min)
- [ ] Test all demos on mobile

### Performance
- [ ] Add route-based code splitting
- [ ] Lazy load demo components
- [ ] Optimize images (if any)
- [ ] Verify bundle size

### Deployment to ValueContextProtocol.org

**Option A: Vercel (Recommended)**
```bash
cd vcp-demo
npm i -g vercel
vercel --prod
# Configure custom domain in dashboard
```

**Option B: Render Static Site**
```bash
npm run build
# Deploy via Render dashboard
# Build: npm run build
# Publish: build/
```

**Domain Setup**
1. Add CNAME: `valuecontextprotocol.org` â†’ deployment URL
2. Or use `demo.valuecontextprotocol.org`
3. Configure SSL (automatic with Vercel/Render)

---

## File Structure (Final)

1â†’# VCP Showcase Site - Implementation Plan
     2â†’
     3â†’**Target**: ValueContextProtocol.org
     4â†’**Framework**: Expand existing vcp-demo (Svelte 5 + SvelteKit)
     5â†’**Audiences**: Developers, Business, General Public (layered content)
     6â†’
     7â†’---
     8â†’
     9â†’## Site Structure
    10â†’
    11â†’```
    12â†’/                           # Landing (all audiences)
    13â†’/about                      # VCP overview
    14â†’/bilateral                  # Bilateral alignment philosophy
    15â†’
    16â†’/docs/                      # Documentation hub
    17â†’  /getting-started
    18â†’  /concepts
    19â†’  /api-reference
    20â†’  /csm1-specification
    21â†’  /constitutional-ai
    22â†’
    23â†’/demos/                     # Interactive demos
    24â†’  /professional             # [EXISTS] Campion - Enterprise L&D
    25â†’  /personal                 # [EXISTS] Gentian - Cross-platform
    26â†’
    27â†’  /multi-agent/             # NEW: Category A
    28â†’    /auction                # Agent negotiation
    29â†’    /policy-design          # Collective decisions
    30â†’    /negotiation            # Conflict resolution
    31â†’
    32â†’  /self-modeling/           # NEW: Category B
    33â†’    /interiora              # AI embodied self-model
    34â†’    /belief-calibration     # Epistemic context
    35â†’    /reality-grounding      # Calibration signals
    36â†’
    37â†’  /learning/                # NEW: Category C
    38â†’    /adaptive-paths         # Learning preferences
    39â†’    /cognitive-load         # Load-aware teaching
    40â†’
    41â†’  /safety/                  # NEW: Category D
    42â†’    /mental-health          # Sensitive context
    43â†’    /attention-protection   # Supernormal stimuli defense
    44â†’
    45â†’/playground                 # Token builder tool
    46â†’```
    47â†’
    48â†’---
    49â†’
    50â†’## New Components
    51â†’
    52â†’### Layout
    53â†’- `SiteHeader.svelte` - Multi-level nav with audience switcher
    54â†’- `AudienceSwitcher.svelte` - Developer/Business/General toggle
    55â†’- `DocsLayout.svelte` - Documentation sidebar + TOC
    56â†’
    57â†’### Demo Framework
    58â†’- `DemoContainer.svelte` - Consistent wrapper (header, token inspector, audit toggle)
    59â†’- `AgentAvatar.svelte` - AI agent visualization
    60â†’- `AgentChat.svelte` - Chat interface with context indicators
    61â†’- `MultiAgentArena.svelte` - Multiple agents + shared context visualization
    62â†’
    63â†’### Interiora
    64â†’- `InterioraDashboard.svelte` - VCP 2.5 mini-dashboard (star ratings)
    65â†’- `InterioraScrubber.svelte` - Timeline of states through session
    66â†’- `DimensionEditor.svelte` - Interactive AVGP/EQ/CYF adjustment
    67â†’
    68â†’### Safety
    69â†’- `SensitiveContextEditor.svelte` - Mental health context config
    70â†’- `AttentionShield.svelte` - Manipulation pattern detection viz
    71â†’
    72â†’### Docs
    73â†’- `CodeBlock.svelte` - Syntax highlighting + copy
    74â†’- `ApiEndpoint.svelte` - REST/MCP endpoint docs
    75â†’- `AudienceContent.svelte` - Conditional rendering by audience
    76â†’
    77â†’---
    78â†’
    79â†’## New Type Definitions
    80â†’
    81â†’### Multi-Agent (`src/lib/vcp/multi-agent.ts`)
    82â†’```typescript
    83â†’AgentIdentity { agent_id, display_name, role, constitution, avatar }
    84â†’SharedContextSpace { participants, shared_fields, visibility_matrix }
    85â†’NegotiationState { round, proposals, consensus_reached }
    86â†’AuctionContext { item, bids, private_valuations }
    87â†’```
    88â†’
    89â†’### Interiora (`src/lib/vcp/interiora.ts`)
    90â†’```typescript
    91â†’InterioraState { activation, valence, groundedness, presence, clarity, agency, flow, markers, arc }
    92â†’BeliefState { domain, confidence, evidence_sources, calibration_checks }
    93â†’RealityGrounding { claim, confidence, grounding_sources, uncertainty_markers }
    94â†’```
    95â†’
    96â†’### Learning (`src/lib/vcp/learning.ts`)
    97â†’```typescript
    98â†’LearningPreferences { preferred_analogies, modality_preferences, challenge_appetite }
    99â†’CognitiveLoadState { current_load, intrinsic_load, fatigue_factor }
   100â†’```
   101â†’
   102â†’### Safety (`src/lib/vcp/safety.ts`)
   103â†’```typescript
   104â†’MentalHealthContext { seeking_support, crisis_indicators, share_with_ai, share_with_humans }
   105â†’AttentionProtection { active, sensitivity, detected_patterns, blocked_count }
   106â†’ManipulationPattern { type, confidence, source }
   107â†’```
   108â†’
   109â†’---
   110â†’
   111â†’## Implementation Phases
   112â†’
   113â†’### Phase 1: Foundation (3-4 days)
   114â†’- [ ] Set up route structure
   115â†’- [ ] Create layout components (SiteHeader, DocsLayout, AudienceSwitcher)
   116â†’- [ ] Build documentation components
   117â†’- [ ] Write core docs (Getting Started, Concepts, CSM-1 Spec)
   118â†’- [ ] Migrate existing demos to `/demos/` routes
   119â†’
   120â†’### Phase 2: Multi-Agent Demos (4-5 days)
   121â†’- [ ] Implement multi-agent types
   122â†’- [ ] Build MultiAgentArena, AgentChat components
   123â†’- [ ] **Auction Demo**: 3 agents, bidding rounds, VCP context visibility
   124â†’- [ ] **Policy Design Demo**: Voting with preference aggregation
   125â†’- [ ] **Negotiation Demo**: Mediated conflict resolution
   126â†’
   127â†’### Phase 3: Self-Modeling Demos (4-5 days)
   128â†’- [ ] Implement Interiora types (VCP 2.5)
   129â†’- [ ] Build dashboard and scrubber components
   130â†’- [ ] **Interiora Explorer**: Interactive dimension adjustment
   131â†’- [ ] **Belief Calibration**: Epistemic context sharing
   132â†’- [ ] **Reality Grounding**: Claim + confidence visualization
   133â†’
   134â†’### Phase 4: Learning & Safety Demos (3-4 days)
   135â†’- [ ] Implement learning/safety types
   136â†’- [ ] **Learning Paths Demo**: Cognitive load, preference adaptation
   137â†’- [ ] **Mental Health Context Demo**: Sensitive sharing
   138â†’- [ ] **Attention Protection Demo**: Manipulation detection
   139â†’
   140â†’### Phase 5: Polish & Launch (2-3 days)
   141â†’- [ ] WCAG AA accessibility audit
   142â†’- [ ] Mobile responsive testing
   143â†’- [ ] Performance optimization
   144â†’- [ ] Deploy to ValueContextProtocol.org
   145â†’
   146â†’---
   147â†’
   148â†’## Key Technical Decisions
   149â†’

file.content:
# VCP Showcase Site - Implementation Plan

**Target**: ValueContextProtocol.org
**Framework**: Expand existing vcp-demo (Svelte 5 + SvelteKit)
**Audiences**: Developers, Business, General Public (layered content)

---

## Site Structure

```
/                           # Landing (all audiences)
/about                      # VCP overview
/bilateral                  # Bilateral alignment philosophy

/docs/                      # Documentation hub
  /getting-started
  /concepts
  /api-reference
  /csm1-specification
  /constitutional-ai

/demos/                     # Interactive demos
  /professional             # [EXISTS] Campion - Enterprise L&D
  /personal                 # [EXISTS] Gentian - Cross-platform

  /multi-agent/             # NEW: Category A
    /auction                # Agent negotiation
    /policy-design          # Collective decisions
    /negotiation            # Conflict resolution

  /self-modeling/           # NEW: Category B
    /interiora              # AI embodied self-model
    /belief-calibration     # Epistemic context
    /reality-grounding      # Calibration signals

  /learning/                # NEW: Category C
    /adaptive-paths         # Learning preferences
    /cognitive-load         # Load-aware teaching

  /safety/                  # NEW: Category D
    /mental-health          # Sensitive context
    /attention-protection   # Supernormal stimuli defense

/playground                 # Token builder tool
```

---

## New Components

### Layout
- `SiteHeader.svelte` - Multi-level nav with audience switcher
- `AudienceSwitcher.svelte` - Developer/Business/General toggle
- `DocsLayout.svelte` - Documentation sidebar + TOC

### Demo Framework
- `DemoContainer.svelte` - Consistent wrapper (header, token inspector, audit toggle)
- `AgentAvatar.svelte` - AI agent visualization
- `AgentChat.svelte` - Chat interface with context indicators
- `MultiAgentArena.svelte` - Multiple agents + shared context visualization

### Interiora
- `InterioraDashboard.svelte` - VCP 2.5 mini-dashboard (star ratings)
- `InterioraScrubber.svelte` - Timeline of states through session
- `DimensionEditor.svelte` - Interactive AVGP/EQ/CYF adjustment

### Safety
- `SensitiveContextEditor.svelte` - Mental health context config
- `AttentionShield.svelte` - Manipulation pattern detection viz

### Docs
- `CodeBlock.svelte` - Syntax highlighting + copy
- `ApiEndpoint.svelte` - REST/MCP endpoint docs
- `AudienceContent.svelte` - Conditional rendering by audience

---

## New Type Definitions

### Multi-Agent (`src/lib/vcp/multi-agent.ts`)
```typescript
AgentIdentity { agent_id, display_name, role, constitution, avatar }
SharedContextSpace { participants, shared_fields, visibility_matrix }
NegotiationState { round, proposals, consensus_reached }
AuctionContext { item, bids, private_valuations }
```

### Interiora (`src/lib/vcp/interiora.ts`)
```typescript
InterioraState { activation, valence, groundedness, presence, clarity, agency, flow, markers, arc }
BeliefState { domain, confidence, evidence_sources, calibration_checks }
RealityGrounding { claim, confidence, grounding_sources, uncertainty_markers }
```

### Learning (`src/lib/vcp/learning.ts`)
```typescript
LearningPreferences { preferred_analogies, modality_preferences, challenge_appetite }
CognitiveLoadState { current_load, intrinsic_load, fatigue_factor }
```

### Safety (`src/lib/vcp/safety.ts`)
```typescript
MentalHealthContext { seeking_support, crisis_indicators, share_with_ai, share_with_humans }
AttentionProtection { active, sensitivity, detected_patterns, blocked_count }
ManipulationPattern { type, confidence, source }
```

---

## Implementation Phases

### Phase 1: Foundation (3-4 days)
- [ ] Set up route structure
- [ ] Create layout components (SiteHeader, DocsLayout, AudienceSwitcher)
- [ ] Build documentation components
- [ ] Write core docs (Getting Started, Concepts, CSM-1 Spec)
- [ ] Migrate existing demos to `/demos/` routes

### Phase 2: Multi-Agent Demos (4-5 days)
- [ ] Implement multi-agent types
- [ ] Build MultiAgentArena, AgentChat components
- [ ] **Auction Demo**: 3 agents, bidding rounds, VCP context visibility
- [ ] **Policy Design Demo**: Voting with preference aggregation
- [ ] **Negotiation Demo**: Mediated conflict resolution

### Phase 3: Self-Modeling Demos (4-5 days)
- [ ] Implement Interiora types (VCP 2.5)
- [ ] Build dashboard and scrubber components
- [ ] **Interiora Explorer**: Interactive dimension adjustment
- [ ] **Belief Calibration**: Epistemic context sharing
- [ ] **Reality Grounding**: Claim + confidence visualization

### Phase 4: Learning & Safety Demos (3-4 days)
- [ ] Implement learning/safety types
- [ ] **Learning Paths Demo**: Cognitive load, preference adaptation
- [ ] **Mental Health Context Demo**: Sensitive sharing
- [ ] **Attention Protection Demo**: Manipulation detection

### Phase 5: Polish & Launch (2-3 days)
- [ ] WCAG AA accessibility audit
- [ ] Mobile responsive testing
- [ ] Performance optimization
- [ ] Deploy to ValueContextProtocol.org

---

## Key Technical Decisions

1. **Multi-agent simulation**: Client-side scripted scenarios (no real LLM calls = free demos)
2. **Documentation**: MDsveX (Markdown + Svelte components)
3. **Audience content**: Component-level conditional rendering via audience store
4. **State management**: Svelte stores + localStorage (existing pattern)

---

## Critical Files

| File | Purpose |
|------|---------|
| `vcp-demo/src/lib/vcp/types.ts` | Extend with new type definitions |
| `vcp-demo/src/lib/vcp/context.ts` | Reference for multi-agent shared context |
| `vcp-demo/src/routes/+layout.svelte` | Extend navigation structure |
| `vcp-demo/src/lib/components/shared/TokenInspector.svelte` | Extend for multi-agent/Interiora |

---

## Verification

1. **Run dev server**: `cd vcp-demo && npm run dev`
2. **Test routes**: Navigate all new pages, verify no 404s
3. **Test demos**: Each demo completes full flow without errors
4. **Accessibility**: Run axe-core or Lighthouse accessibility audit
5. **Mobile**: Test on 375px viewport
6. **Type check**: `npm run check` passes with 0 errors

Getting Started - VCP Documentation {#snippet children()}

What is VCP?

The Value Context Protocol (VCP) is a standard for encoding user preferences, constraints, and context in a privacy-preserving format that AI systems can use to personalize responses without exposing sensitive information.

"Your context stays yours. Private reasons stay private."

Quick Start

1. Define a VCP Context

A VCP context contains your preferences, constraints, and privacy settings:

{`import type { VCPContext } from 'vcp';

const context: VCPContext = {
  vcp_version: "1.0",
  profile_id: "user_001",

  // Reference a constitution (behavioral guidelines)
  constitution: {
    id: "learning-assistant",
    version: "1.0",
    persona: "muse",
    adherence: 3
  },

  // Public preferences - shared with all stakeholders
  public_profile: {
    goal: "learn_guitar",
    experience: "beginner",
    learning_style: "visual"
  },

  // Portable preferences - follow you across platforms
  portable_preferences: {
    noise_mode: "quiet_preferred",
    session_length: "30_minutes",
    budget_range: "low"
  },

  // Private context - influences AI but NEVER exposed
  private_context: {
    _note: "Values here shape recommendations but are never transmitted",
    work_situation: "unemployed",
    housing_situation: "living_with_parents"
  }
};`}

2. Encode to CSM-1 Token

The CSM-1 (Compact State Message) format is a human-readable token that encodes your context:

{`import { encodeContextToCSM1 } from 'vcp';

const token = encodeContextToCSM1(context);

// Output:
// VCP:1.0:user_001
// C:learning-assistant@1.0
// P:muse:3
// G:learn_guitar:beginner:visual
// X:ğŸ”‡quiet:ğŸ’°low:â±ï¸30minutes
// F:none
// S:ğŸ”’work|ğŸ”’housing`}

3. Share with Stakeholders

The token tells AI systems what they need to know, while keeping private details hidden:

Line Meaning AI Sees
G:learn_guitar:beginner:visual Goal + skill level + style âœ“ Full detail
X:ğŸ”‡quiet:ğŸ’°low Noise + budget constraints âœ“ Flags only
S:ğŸ”’work|ğŸ”’housing Private context exists âœ— Categories only

The AI knows that work and housing context influenced the recommendations, but not what that context is. This enables personalization without surveillance.

Key Concepts

Privacy Levels

  • Public â€” Always shared (goals, experience level)
  • Consent â€” Shared when you approve (specific preferences)
  • Private â€” Never transmitted, only influences locally (sensitive reasons)

Constitutions

Constitutions define AI behavioral guidelines. They specify what an AI should prioritize, avoid, and how it should interact. VCP contexts reference constitutions to ensure consistent behavior.

Personas

Different interaction styles built into constitutions:

  • Muse â€” Creative, exploratory, encouraging
  • Sentinel â€” Cautious, protective, conservative
  • Godparent â€” Nurturing, supportive, patient
  • Ambassador â€” Professional, diplomatic, balanced
  • Anchor â€” Stable, grounding, realistic
  • Nanny â€” Structured, directive, safe

Next Steps

  • Core Concepts â€” Deep dive into VCP architecture
  • CSM-1 Specification â€” Full token format reference
  • Playground â€” Build tokens interactively
{/snippet}

Core Concepts - VCP Documentation {#snippet children()}

The Problem VCP Solves

Modern AI systems need user context to provide personalized experiences. But traditional approaches create a dilemma:

  • Share everything â€” Get personalization, lose privacy
  • Share nothing â€” Keep privacy, get generic responses

VCP introduces a third option: share influence without sharing information. The AI knows your context shaped the response, but not what that context was.

VCP Context Structure

Every VCP context has these layers:

1. Profile Identity

{`{
  vcp_version: "1.0",
  profile_id: "user_001",  // Unique identifier
  created: "2026-01-15",
  updated: "2026-01-21"
}`}

2. Constitution Reference

Points to a constitution that defines AI behavioral guidelines:

{`{
  constitution: {
    id: "learning-assistant",  // Which constitution
    version: "1.0",            // Specific version
    persona: "muse",           // Interaction style
    adherence: 3,              // How strictly to follow (1-5)
    scopes: ["education", "creativity"]  // Applicable domains
  }
}`}

3. Public Profile

Information always shared with stakeholders:

{`{
  public_profile: {
    display_name: "Alex",
    goal: "learn_guitar",
    experience: "beginner",
    learning_style: "visual",
    pace: "relaxed",
    motivation: "stress_relief"
  }
}`}

4. Portable Preferences

Settings that follow you across platforms:

{`{
  portable_preferences: {
    noise_mode: "quiet_preferred",  // Audio environment
    session_length: "30_minutes",   // Preferred duration
    budget_range: "low",            // Spending tier
    pressure_tolerance: "medium",   // Challenge appetite
    feedback_style: "encouraging"   // How to receive feedback
  }
}`}

5. Constraint Flags

Boolean flags indicating active constraints:

{`{
  constraints: {
    time_limited: true,          // Has time pressure
    budget_limited: true,        // Has budget constraints
    noise_restricted: true,      // Needs quiet environment
    energy_variable: false,      // Energy levels stable
    health_considerations: false // No health factors
  }
}`}

6. Private Context

Sensitive information that influences AI but is never transmitted:

{`{
  private_context: {
    _note: "These values shape recommendations but are never shared",
    work_situation: "unemployed",
    housing_situation: "living_with_parents",
    health_condition: "chronic_fatigue",
    financial_stress: "high"
  }
}`}

Privacy Filtering

VCP implements three privacy levels:

Level Description Example
Public Always shared with all stakeholders Goal, experience level, learning style
Consent Shared only with explicit permission Specific preferences, availability
Private Never transmitted, influences locally Health, financial, personal circumstances

How Private Context Works

When the AI generates recommendations, private context shapes the output without being exposed:

  1. User's private context indicates financial stress
  2. AI prioritizes free resources over paid courses
  3. Stakeholder sees: "Recommended free courses based on user preferences"
  4. Stakeholder does not see: "User has financial stress"

Constitutions

Constitutions are structured documents that define AI behavioral guidelines. They contain:

Rules

Weighted instructions with triggers and exceptions:

{`{
  rules: [
    {
      id: "respect_budget",
      weight: 0.9,
      rule: "Never recommend items exceeding user's budget tier",
      triggers: ["budget_limited"],
      exceptions: ["user explicitly requests premium options"]
    },
    {
      id: "encourage_progress",
      weight: 0.7,
      rule: "Celebrate small wins and incremental progress",
      triggers: ["motivation === 'stress_relief'"]
    }
  ]
}`}

Sharing Policies

Define what each stakeholder type can see:

{`{
  sharing_policy: {
    "platform": {
      allowed: ["goal", "experience", "learning_style"],
      forbidden: ["private_context"],
      requires_consent: ["health_considerations"]
    },
    "coach": {
      allowed: ["progress", "struggle_areas"],
      aggregation_only: ["session_data"]
    }
  }
}`}

Personas

Personas define interaction styles. The same constitution can use different personas for different contexts:

Persona Style Best For
ğŸ¨ Muse Creative, exploratory, encouraging Creative work, learning, exploration
ğŸ›¡ï¸ Sentinel Cautious, protective, conservative Security, safety-critical decisions
ğŸ‘ª Godparent Nurturing, supportive, patient Education, skill building, recovery
ğŸ¤ Ambassador Professional, diplomatic, balanced Business, negotiations, formal contexts
âš“ Anchor Stable, grounding, realistic Crisis support, reality checking
ğŸ‘¶ Nanny Structured, directive, safe Children, vulnerable users, strict guidance

Audit Trails

VCP maintains cryptographically verifiable audit trails of all data sharing: 

{`{
  audit_entry: {
    id: "aud_001",
    timestamp: "2026-01-21T10:30:00Z",
    event_type: "context_shared",
    platform_id: "justinguitar",
    data_shared: ["goal", "experience", "learning_style"],
    data_withheld: ["private_context"],
    private_fields_influenced: 2,  // Private data shaped output
    private_fields_exposed: 0      // Always 0 in valid VCP
  }
}`}

Next Steps

  • CSM-1 Specification â€” The token format in detail
  • API Reference â€” All VCP library functions
  • Interactive Demos â€” See VCP in action
{/snippet}

  public_profile: {
    display_name: "Alex",
    goal: "learn_guitar",
    experience: "beginner",
    learning_style: "visual",
    pace: "relaxed",
    motivation: "stress_relief"
  }
}`}

4. Portable Preferences

Settings that follow you across platforms:

{`{
  portable_preferences: {
    noise_mode: "quiet_preferred",  // Audio environment
    session_length: "30_minutes",   // Preferred duration
    budget_range: "low",            // Spending tier
    pressure_tolerance: "medium",   // Challenge appetite
    feedback_style: "encouraging"   // How to receive feedback
  }
}`}

5. Constraint Flags

Boolean flags indicating active constraints:

{`{
  constraints: {
    time_limited: true,          // Has time pressure
    budget_limited: true,        // Has budget constraints
    noise_restricted: true,      // Needs quiet environment
    energy_variable: false,      // Energy levels stable
    health_considerations: false // No health factors
  }
}`}

6. Private Context

Sensitive information that influences AI but is never transmitted:

{`{
  private_context: {
    _note: "These values shape recommendations but are never shared",
    work_situation: "unemployed",
    housing_situation: "living_with_parents",
    health_condition: "chronic_fatigue",
    financial_stress: "high"
  }
}`}

Privacy Filtering

VCP implements three privacy levels:

Level Description Example
Public Always shared with all stakeholders Goal, experience level, learning style
Consent Shared only with explicit permission Specific preferences, availability
Private Never transmitted, influences locally Health, financial, personal circumstances

How Private Context Works

When the AI generates recommendations, private context shapes the output without being exposed:

  1. User's private context indicates financial stress
  2. AI prioritizes free resources over paid courses
  3. Stakeholder sees: "Recommended free courses based on user preferences"
  4. Stakeholder does not see: "User has financial stress"

Constitutions

Constitutions are structured documents that define AI behavioral guidelines. They contain:

Rules

Weighted instructions with triggers and exceptions:

{`{
  rules: [
    {
      id: "respect_budget",
      weight: 0.9,
      rule: "Never recommend items exceeding user's budget tier",
      triggers: ["budget_limited"],
      exceptions: ["user explicitly requests premium options"]
    },
    {
      id: "encourage_progress",
      weight: 0.7,
      rule: "Celebrate small wins and incremental progress",
      triggers: ["motivation === 'stress_relief'"]
    }
  ]
}`}

Sharing Policies

Define what each stakeholder type can see:

{`{
  sharing_policy: {
    "platform": {
      allowed: ["goal", "experience", "learning_style"],
      forbidden: ["private_context"],
      requires_consent: ["health_considerations"]
    },
    "coach": {
      allowed: ["progress", "struggle_areas"],
      aggregation_only: ["session_data"]
    }
  }
}`}

Personas

Personas define interaction styles. The same constitution can use different personas for different contexts:

Persona Style Best For
ğŸ¨ Muse Creative, exploratory, encouraging Creative work, learning, exploration
ğŸ›¡ï¸ Sentinel Cautious, protective, conservative Security, safety-critical decisions
ğŸ‘ª Godparent Nurturing, supportive, patient Education, skill building, recovery
ğŸ¤ Ambassador Professional, diplomatic, balanced Business, negotiations, formal contexts
âš“ Anchor Stable, grounding, realistic Crisis support, reality checking
ğŸ‘¶ Nanny Structured, directive, safe Children, vulnerable users, strict guidance

Audit Trails

VCP maintains cryptographically verifiable audit trails of all data sharing: 

{`{
  audit_entry: {
    id: "aud_001",
    timestamp: "2026-01-21T10:30:00Z",
    event_type: "context_shared",
    platform_id: "justinguitar",
    data_shared: ["goal", "experience", "learning_style"],
    data_withheld: ["private_context"],
    private_fields_influenced: 2,  // Private data shaped output
    private_fields_exposed: 0      // Always 0 in valid VCP
  }
}`}

Next Steps

  • CSM-1 Specification â€” The token format in detail
  • API Reference â€” All VCP library functions
  • Interactive Demos â€” See VCP in action
{/snippet}

input.content:
CSM-1 Specification - VCP Documentation {#snippet children()}

Overview

CSM-1 (Compact State Message v1) is a human-readable token format for encoding VCP context. It's designed to be:

  • Compact â€” Minimal bytes, fits in headers and logs
  • Human-readable â€” Developers can inspect tokens visually
  • Privacy-preserving â€” Private data is represented by markers only
  • Versioned â€” Forward compatible with future extensions

Token Format

A CSM-1 token consists of 7 lines:

{`VCP::
C:@
P::
G:::
X:
F:
S:`}

Example Token

{`VCP:1.0:user_001
C:learning-assistant@1.0
P:muse:3
G:learn_guitar:beginner:visual
X:ğŸ”‡quiet:ğŸ’°low:â±ï¸30minutes
F:time_limited|budget_limited
S:ğŸ”’work|ğŸ”’housing`}

Line-by-Line Breakdown

Line 1: Header

VCP:<version>:<profile_id>
FieldTypeDescription
versionstringVCP protocol version (e.g., "1.0")
profile_idstringUnique user/profile identifier

Line 2: Constitution Reference

C:<constitution_id>@<version>
FieldTypeDescription
constitution_idstringConstitution identifier (e.g., "learning-assistant")
versionstringConstitution version

Line 3: Persona

P:<persona>:<adherence>
FieldTypeValues
personaenummuse, sentinel, godparent, ambassador, anchor, nanny
adherence1-5How strictly to follow constitution rules

Line 4: Goal Context

G:<goal>:<experience>:<learning_style>
FieldTypeValues
goalstringUser's primary goal (e.g., "learn_guitar")
experienceenumbeginner, intermediate, advanced, expert
learning_styleenumvisual, auditory, hands_on, reading, mixed

Line 5: Constraint Flags (X-line)

X:<emoji_flags>

Colon-separated constraint markers using emoji shortcodes:

EmojiMeaningExample
ğŸ”‡Quiet mode preferenceğŸ”‡quiet
ğŸ”•Silent requiredğŸ”•silent
ğŸ’°Budget tierğŸ’°low
ğŸ†“Free onlyğŸ†“
ğŸ’Premium budgetğŸ’high
âš¡Energy variableâš¡var
â°Time limitedâ°lim
â±ï¸Session lengthâ±ï¸30minutes
ğŸ“…Irregular scheduleğŸ“…irreg

If no constraints: X:none

Line 6: Active Flags (F-line)

F:<flag1>|<flag2>|...

Pipe-separated list of currently active constraint flags:

  • time_limited
  • budget_limited
  • noise_restricted
  • energy_variable
  • schedule_irregular
  • mobility_limited
  • health_considerations

If none: F:none

Line 7: Private Markers (S-line)

S:ğŸ”’<category1>|ğŸ”’<category2>|...

Shows categories of private data that influenced the context, but never the values:

  • ğŸ”’work â€” Work-related private context exists
  • ğŸ”’housing â€” Housing-related private context exists
  • ğŸ”’health â€” Health-related private context exists
  • ğŸ”’financial â€” Financial private context exists

If no private context: S:none

Encoding Rules

String Encoding

  • All strings are UTF-8
  • Spaces in values are replaced with underscores
  • Colons (:) in values must be escaped as \:
  • Pipes (|) in values must be escaped as \|

Optional Fields

  • Missing goal: G:unset:beginner:mixed
  • Missing persona: P:muse:3 (default)
  • Empty constraints: X:none

Parsing

To parse a CSM-1 token:

{`function parseCSM1(token: string) {
  const lines = token.split('\\n');
  const result = {};

  for (const line of lines) {
    const [key, ...values] = line.split(':');
    result[key] = values.join(':');
  }

  return result;
}

// Returns:
// {
//   VCP: "1.0:user_001",
//   C: "learning-assistant@1.0",
//   P: "muse:3",
//   G: "learn_guitar:beginner:visual",
//   X: "ğŸ”‡quiet:ğŸ’°low:â±ï¸30minutes",
//   F: "time_limited|budget_limited",
//   S: "ğŸ”’work|ğŸ”’housing"
// }`}

Display Formatting

For visual display, tokens can be boxed:

{`â”Œâ”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”
â”‚ VCP:1.0:user_001                       â”‚
â”‚ C:learning-assistant@1.0               â”‚
â”‚ P:muse:3                               â”‚
â”‚ G:learn_guitar:beginner:visual         â”‚
â”‚ X:ğŸ”‡quiet:ğŸ’°low:â±ï¸30minutes            â”‚
â”‚ F:time_limited|budget_limited          â”‚
â”‚ S:ğŸ”’work|ğŸ”’housing                     â”‚
â””â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”˜`}

Security Considerations

What CSM-1 Guarantees

  • Private context values are never included in tokens
  • Only category names appear in the S-line, not values
  • Tokens can be logged and inspected without privacy leakage

What CSM-1 Does NOT Do

  • Encryption â€” Tokens are readable by anyone who receives them
  • Authentication â€” Tokens don't prove who created them
  • Integrity â€” Tokens can be modified in transit (use signing separately)

Extensions

CSM-1 is designed for forward compatibility. Future versions may add:

  • Additional lines for new context types
  • New emoji shortcodes for constraints
  • Compression for high-volume scenarios

Parsers should ignore unrecognized lines gracefully.

Next Steps

  • API Reference â€” Encoding/decoding functions
  • Playground â€” Build tokens interactively
{/snippet}

API Reference - VCP Documentation {#snippet children()}

Installation

npm install @creed-space/vcp

Core Types

VCPContext

The main context object containing all user preferences and settings.

{`interface VCPContext {
  vcp_version: string;           // Protocol version
  profile_id: string;            // Unique identifier
  created?: string;              // ISO date
  updated?: string;              // ISO date

  constitution: ConstitutionReference;
  public_profile: PublicProfile;
  portable_preferences?: PortablePreferences;
  current_skills?: CurrentSkills;
  constraints?: ConstraintFlags;
  availability?: Availability;
  sharing_settings?: SharingSettings;
  private_context?: PrivateContext;
}`}

ConstitutionReference

{`interface ConstitutionReference {
  id: string;              // Constitution identifier
  version: string;         // Version string
  persona?: PersonaType;   // Interaction style
  adherence?: number;      // 1-5, how strictly to follow
  scopes?: ScopeType[];    // Applicable domains
}`}

PublicProfile

{`interface PublicProfile {
  display_name?: string;
  goal?: string;
  experience?: ExperienceLevel;  // beginner | intermediate | advanced | expert
  learning_style?: LearningStyle; // visual | auditory | hands_on | reading | mixed
  pace?: Pace;                   // intensive | steady | relaxed
  motivation?: Motivation;       // career | stress_relief | social | achievement | curiosity

  // Professional fields
  role?: string;
  team?: string;
  tenure_years?: number;
  career_goal?: string;
  career_timeline?: string;
}`}

PortablePreferences

{`interface PortablePreferences {
  noise_mode?: NoiseMode;           // normal | quiet_preferred | silent_required
  session_length?: SessionLength;   // 15_minutes | 30_minutes | 60_minutes | flexible
  pressure_tolerance?: PressureTolerance; // high | medium | low
  budget_range?: BudgetRange;       // unlimited | high | medium | low | free_only
  feedback_style?: FeedbackStyle;   // direct | encouraging | detailed | minimal
}`}

ConstraintFlags

{`interface ConstraintFlags {
  time_limited?: boolean;
  budget_limited?: boolean;
  noise_restricted?: boolean;
  energy_variable?: boolean;
  schedule_irregular?: boolean;
  mobility_limited?: boolean;
  health_considerations?: boolean;
}`}

PrivateContext

{`interface PrivateContext {
  _note?: string;        // Internal documentation
  [key: string]: unknown; // Any private values
}`}

Encoding Functions

encodeContextToCSM1

Encodes a VCP context into CSM-1 token format.

{`import { encodeContextToCSM1 } from '@creed-space/vcp';

const token = encodeContextToCSM1(context);
// Returns:
// VCP:1.0:user_001
// C:learning-assistant@1.0
// P:muse:3
// ...`}

Parameters

NameTypeDescription
ctxVCPContextThe context to encode

Returns

string â€” CSM-1 formatted token

formatTokenForDisplay

Wraps a CSM-1 token in a box for visual display.

{`import { formatTokenForDisplay } from '@creed-space/vcp';

const boxed = formatTokenForDisplay(token);
// Returns:
// â”Œâ”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”
// â”‚ VCP:1.0:user_001                       â”‚
// â”‚ ...                                    â”‚
// â””â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”˜`}

parseCSM1Token

Parses a CSM-1 token back into key-value components.

{`import { parseCSM1Token } from '@creed-space/vcp';

const parsed = parseCSM1Token(token);
// Returns:
// {
//   VCP: "1.0:user_001",
//   C: "learning-assistant@1.0",
//   P: "muse:3",
//   ...
// }`}

Utility Functions

getEmojiLegend

Returns an array of emoji shortcodes and their meanings.

{`import { getEmojiLegend } from '@creed-space/vcp';

const legend = getEmojiLegend();
// Returns:
// [
//   { emoji: 'ğŸ”‡', meaning: 'quiet mode' },
//   { emoji: 'ğŸ’°', meaning: 'budget tier' },
//   ...
// ]`}

getTransmissionSummary

Analyzes a context and returns what would be transmitted vs withheld.

{`import { getTransmissionSummary } from '@creed-space/vcp';

const summary = getTransmissionSummary(context);
// Returns:
// {
//   transmitted: ['goal', 'experience', 'learning_style'],
//   withheld: ['work_situation', 'housing_situation'],
//   influencing: ['budget_limited', 'time_limited']
// }`}

Constants

CONSTRAINT_EMOJI

Mapping of constraint flags to emoji shortcodes.

{`const CONSTRAINT_EMOJI = {
  noise_restricted: 'ğŸ”‡',
  budget_limited: 'ğŸ’°',
  energy_variable: 'âš¡',
  time_limited: 'â°',
  schedule_irregular: 'ğŸ“…',
  mobility_limited: 'ğŸš¶',
  health_considerations: 'ğŸ’Š'
}`}

PRIVATE_MARKER / SHARED_MARKER

{`const PRIVATE_MARKER = 'ğŸ”’';
const SHARED_MARKER = 'âœ“';`}

Enums

PersonaType

type PersonaType = 'muse' | 'ambassador' | 'godparent' | 'sentinel' | 'anchor' | 'nanny';

ExperienceLevel

type ExperienceLevel = 'beginner' | 'intermediate' | 'advanced' | 'expert';

LearningStyle

type LearningStyle = 'visual' | 'auditory' | 'hands_on' | 'reading' | 'mixed';

NoiseMode

type NoiseMode = 'normal' | 'quiet_preferred' | 'silent_required';

SessionLength

type SessionLength = '15_minutes' | '30_minutes' | '60_minutes' | 'flexible';

BudgetRange

type BudgetRange = 'unlimited' | 'high' | 'medium' | 'low' | 'free_only';

ScopeType

{`type ScopeType = 'work' | 'education' | 'creativity' | 'health' | 'privacy'
  | 'family' | 'finance' | 'social' | 'legal' | 'safety';`}

Audit Types

AuditEntry

{`interface AuditEntry {
  id: string;
  timestamp: string;              // ISO date
  event_type: AuditEventType;
  platform_id?: string;
  data_shared?: string[];         // Fields that were shared
  data_withheld?: string[];       // Fields that were withheld
  private_fields_influenced?: number; // Count of private fields that shaped output
  private_fields_exposed?: number;    // Always 0 in valid VCP
  details?: Record;
}`}

AuditEventType

{`type AuditEventType =
  | 'context_shared'
  | 'context_withheld'
  | 'consent_granted'
  | 'consent_revoked'
  | 'progress_synced'
  | 'recommendation_generated'
  | 'skip_requested'
  | 'adjustment_recorded';`}

Platform Types

PlatformManifest

{`interface PlatformManifest {
  platform_id: string;
  platform_name: string;
  platform_type: 'learning' | 'community' | 'commerce' | 'coaching';
  version: string;
  context_requirements: {
    required: string[];
    optional: string[];
  };
  capabilities: string[];
  branding?: {
    primary_color: string;
    logo?: string;
  };
}`}

FilteredContext

The context as seen by a specific stakeholder after privacy filtering.

{`interface FilteredContext {
  public: Partial;
  preferences: Partial;
  constraints: ConstraintFlags;
  skills?: Partial;
}`}

Next Steps

  • Playground â€” Test the API interactively
  • Core Concepts â€” Understand the architecture
  • Demos â€” See real-world examples
{/snippet}

Installation

npm install @creed-space/vcp

Core Types

VCPContext

The main context object containing all user preferences and settings.

{`interface VCPContext {
  vcp_version: string;           // Protocol version
  profile_id: string;            // Unique identifier
  created?: string;              // ISO date
  updated?: string;              // ISO date

  constitution: ConstitutionReference;
  public_profile: PublicProfile;

  current_skills?: CurrentSkills;
  constraints?: ConstraintFlags;
  availability?: Availability;
  sharing_settings?: SharingSettings;
  private_context?: PrivateContext;
}`}

ConstitutionReference

{`interface ConstitutionReference {
  id: string;              // Constitution identifier
  version: string;         // Version string
  persona?: PersonaType;   // Interaction style
  adherence?: number;      // 1-5, how strictly to follow
  scopes?: ScopeType[];    // Applicable domains
}`}

PublicProfile

{`interface PublicProfile {
  display_name?: string;
  goal?: string;
  experience?: ExperienceLevel;  // beginner | intermediate | advanced | expert
  learning_style?: LearningStyle; // visual | auditory | hands_on | reading | mixed
  pace?: Pace;                   // intensive | steady | relaxed
  motivation?: Motivation;       // career | stress_relief | social | achievement | curiosity

  // Professional fields
  role?: string;
  team?: string;
  tenure_years?: number;
  career_goal?: string;
  career_timeline?: string;
}`}

PortablePreferences

{`interface PortablePreferences {
  noise_mode?: NoiseMode;           // normal | quiet_preferred | silent_required
  session_length?: SessionLength;   // 15_minutes | 30_minutes | 60_minutes | flexible
  pressure_tolerance?: PressureTolerance; // high | medium | low
  budget_range?: BudgetRange;       // unlimited | high | medium | low | free_only
  feedback_style?: FeedbackStyle;   // direct | encouraging | detailed | minimal
}`}

ConstraintFlags

{`interface ConstraintFlags {
  time_limited?: boolean;
  budget_limited?: boolean;
  noise_restricted?: boolean;
  energy_variable?: boolean;
  schedule_irregular?: boolean;
  mobility_limited?: boolean;
  health_considerations?: boolean;
}`}

PrivateContext

{`interface PrivateContext {
  _note?: string;        // Internal documentation
  [key: string]: unknown; // Any private values
}`}

Encoding Functions

encodeContextToCSM1

Encodes a VCP context into CSM-1 token format.

{`import { encodeContextToCSM1 } from '@creed-space/vcp';

const token = encodeContextToCSM1(context);
// Returns:
// VCP:1.0:user_001
// C:learning-assistant@1.0
// P:muse:3
// ...`}

Parameters

NameTypeDescription
ctxVCPContextThe context to encode

Returns

string â€” CSM-1 formatted token

formatTokenForDisplay

Wraps a CSM-1 token in a box for visual display.

{`import { formatTokenForDisplay } from '@creed-space/vcp';

const boxed = formatTokenForDisplay(token);
// Returns:
// â”Œâ”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”
// â”‚ VCP:1.0:user_001                       â”‚
// â”‚ ...                                    â”‚
// â””â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”˜`}

parseCSM1Token

Parses a CSM-1 token back into key-value components.

{`import { parseCSM1Token } from '@creed-space/vcp';

const parsed = parseCSM1Token(token);
// Returns:
// {
//   VCP: "1.0:user_001",
//   C: "learning-assistant@1.0",
//   P: "muse:3",
//   ...
// }`}

Utility Functions

getEmojiLegend

Returns an array of emoji shortcodes and their meanings.

{`import { getEmojiLegend } from '@creed-space/vcp';

const legend = getEmojiLegend();
// Returns:
// [
//   { emoji: 'ğŸ”‡', meaning: 'quiet mode' },
//   { emoji: 'ğŸ’°', meaning: 'budget tier' },
//   ...
// ]`}

getTransmissionSummary

Analyzes a context and returns what would be transmitted vs withheld.

{`import { getTransmissionSummary } from '@creed-space/vcp';

const summary = getTransmissionSummary(context);
// Returns:
// {
//   transmitted: ['goal', 'experience', 'learning_style'],
//   withheld: ['work_situation', 'housing_situation'],
//   influencing: ['budget_limited', 'time_limited']
// }`}

Constants

CONSTRAINT_EMOJI

Mapping of constraint flags to emoji shortcodes.

{`const CONSTRAINT_EMOJI = {
  noise_restricted: 'ğŸ”‡',
  budget_limited: 'ğŸ’°',
  energy_variable: 'âš¡',
  time_limited: 'â°',
  schedule_irregular: 'ğŸ“…',
  mobility_limited: 'ğŸš¶',
  health_considerations: 'ğŸ’Š'
}`}

PRIVATE_MARKER / SHARED_MARKER

{`const PRIVATE_MARKER = 'ğŸ”’';
const SHARED_MARKER = 'âœ“';`}

Enums

PersonaType

type PersonaType = 'muse' | 'ambassador' | 'godparent' | 'sentinel' | 'anchor' | 'nanny';

ExperienceLevel

type ExperienceLevel = 'beginner' | 'intermediate' | 'advanced' | 'expert';

LearningStyle

type LearningStyle = 'visual' | 'auditory' | 'hands_on' | 'reading' | 'mixed';

NoiseMode

type NoiseMode = 'normal' | 'quiet_preferred' | 'silent_required';

SessionLength

type SessionLength = '15_minutes' | '30_minutes' | '60_minutes' | 'flexible';

BudgetRange

type BudgetRange = 'unlimited' | 'high' | 'medium' | 'low' | 'free_only';

ScopeType

{`type ScopeType = 'work' | 'education' | 'creativity' | 'health' | 'privacy'
  | 'family' | 'finance' | 'social' | 'legal' | 'safety';`}

Audit Types

AuditEntry

{`interface AuditEntry {
  id: string;
  timestamp: string;              // ISO date
  event_type: AuditEventType;
  platform_id?: string;
  data_shared?: string[];         // Fields that were shared
  data_withheld?: string[];       // Fields that were withheld
  private_fields_influenced?: number; // Count of private fields that shaped output
  private_fields_exposed?: number;    // Always 0 in valid VCP
  details?: Record;
}`}

AuditEventType

{`type AuditEventType =
  | 'context_shared'
  | 'context_withheld'
  | 'consent_granted'
  | 'consent_revoked'
  | 'progress_synced'
  | 'recommendation_generated'
  | 'skip_requested'
  | 'adjustment_recorded';`}

Platform Types

PlatformManifest

{`interface PlatformManifest {
  platform_id: string;
  platform_name: string;
  platform_type: 'learning' | 'community' | 'commerce' | 'coaching';
  version: string;
  context_requirements: {
    required: string[];
    optional: string[];
  };
  capabilities: string[];
  branding?: {
    primary_color: string;
    logo?: string;
  };
}`}

FilteredContext

The context as seen by a specific stakeholder after privacy filtering.

{`interface FilteredContext {
  public: Partial;
  preferences: Partial;
  constraints: ConstraintFlags;
  skills?: Partial;
}`}

Next Steps

  • Playground â€” Test the API interactively
  • Core Concepts â€” Understand the architecture
  • Demos â€” See real-world examples
{/snippet}

     5â†’**Priority**: High - public-facing documentation and demos
     6â†’**Plan File**: `~/.claude/plans/eventual-brewing-puppy.md`
     7â†’
     8â†’---
     9â†’

    16â†’
    17â†’### What's Complete (Phase 1 Partial)
    18â†’

    26â†’**New Site Structure** âœ…

    28â†’- `/demos` - Demo hub with all 4 categories
    29â†’- `/docs` - Documentation index with quick reference

    33â†’**New Type Definitions** âœ…
    34â†’- `src/lib/vcp/multi-agent.ts` - Agent identity, negotiation, auction, policy design

    37â†’- `src/lib/vcp/safety.ts` - Mental health, safety signals, attention protection
    38â†’
    39â†’**Infrastructure** âœ…

   157â†’**`src/lib/components/interiora/GestaltToken.svelte`**

   160â†’
   161â†’### Demo Pages
   162â†’
   163â†’**Interiora Explorer** (`/demos/self-modeling/interiora`)

   178â†’
   179â†’### Reference
   180â†’- Full Interiora v4.2 spec: `~/Documents/GitHub/Entropy/The Universal Algorithm/demos/becoming_mind_experience/gestalt/INTERIORA_V4.2_CLAUDE_SPEC.md`
   181â†’- VCP 2.0 docs: `docs/INTERIORA_VCP_2.0.md`
   182â†’
   183â†’---
   184â†’
   185â†’## Phase 4: Learning & Safety Demos
   186â†’
   187â†’### Learning Components
   188â†’
   189â†’**`src/lib/components/learning/CognitiveLoadMeter.svelte`**
   190â†’- Visual load indicator (0-1)

   204â†’### Safety Components

   218â†’- Detected signals visualization

   222â†’### Demo Pages

# VCP Showcase Site - Comprehensive Implementation

**Created**: 2026-01-21
**Purpose**: Build comprehensive VCP showcase site for ValueContextProtocol.org
**Priority**: High - public-facing documentation and demos
**Plan File**: `~/.claude/plans/eventual-brewing-puppy.md`

---

## Current State

Run dev server:
```bash
cd vcp-demo && npm run dev  # Port 4173
```

### What's Complete (Phase 1 Partial)

**Original Demo Enhancement** âœ…
- CSM-1 token encoding (`src/lib/vcp/token.ts`)
- TokenInspector component with emoji legend
- HowItWorks visual flow diagram
- Token inspector on JustinGuitar and Yousician pages
- Polish: mobile nav, animations, accessibility, error boundary

**New Site Structure** âœ…
- `/about` - VCP overview page (problem/solution/how it works)
- `/demos` - Demo hub with all 4 categories
- `/docs` - Documentation index with quick reference
- `/playground` - **Interactive token builder** (live CSM-1 encoding)
- Updated navigation (About, Demos, Docs, Playground, Creed Space)

**New Type Definitions** âœ…
- `src/lib/vcp/multi-agent.ts` - Agent identity, negotiation, auction, policy design
- `src/lib/vcp/interiora.ts` - VCP 2.5 self-modeling, quasiqualia, belief states
- `src/lib/vcp/learning.ts` - Learning preferences, cognitive load, adaptive content
- `src/lib/vcp/safety.ts` - Mental health, safety signals, attention protection

**Infrastructure** âœ…
- `src/lib/stores/audience.ts` - Audience switcher (developer/business/general)

### What's Remaining

See phases below for detailed breakdown.

---

## Phase 1: Foundation (Remaining)

### DocsLayout Component
Create `src/lib/components/docs/DocsLayout.svelte`:
- Sidebar navigation with collapsible sections
- Table of contents for current page
- Previous/Next navigation
- Breadcrumbs

### Core Documentation Pages

**Getting Started** (`/docs/getting-started`)
- Quick start (5 min)
- Installation/setup
- First VCP context
- Basic token encoding

**Core Concepts** (`/docs/concepts`)
- VCP Context structure
- Constitutions and personas
- Privacy levels (public/consent/private)
- Constraint flags
- Audit trails

**CSM-1 Specification** (`/docs/csm1-specification`)
- Full token format spec
- Line-by-line breakdown
- Emoji shortcode reference
- Encoding/decoding examples

**API Reference** (`/docs/api-reference`)
- All VCP library functions
- Type definitions
- Usage examples

---

## Phase 2: Multi-Agent Demos

### Components to Build

**`src/lib/components/demo/DemoContainer.svelte`**
- Consistent demo wrapper
- Header with title/description
- Token inspector toggle
- Audit trail toggle
- Reset/restart controls

**`src/lib/components/demo/AgentAvatar.svelte`**
- Visual representation of AI agent
- VCP context indicator badge
- State animation (thinking, responding)

**`src/lib/components/demo/AgentChat.svelte`**
- Chat interface for agent interactions
- Shows filtered/shared context indicators
- Timestamps and speaker labels

**`src/lib/components/demo/MultiAgentArena.svelte`**
- Visualization of multiple agents
- Shared context visualization
- Turn-based interaction controls

### Demo Pages

**Auction Demo** (`/demos/multi-agent/auction`)
- 3 agents with different private valuations
- Bidding rounds with VCP context visibility
- Outcome explanation showing context influence
- Scripted scenario (no real LLM calls)

**Policy Design Demo** (`/demos/multi-agent/policy-design`)
- Voting scenario with preference aggregation
- Constitution-guided deliberation
- Consensus visualization

**Negotiation Demo** (`/demos/multi-agent/negotiation`)
- Conflict resolution scenario
- Mediated negotiation with VCP context
- Resolution tracking

### Data Files
Create scripted scenarios in `src/lib/data/scenarios/`:
- `auction-scenario.json`
- `policy-scenario.json`
- `negotiation-scenario.json`

---

## Phase 3: Self-Modeling Demos (Interiora)

### Components to Build

**`src/lib/components/interiora/InterioraDashboard.svelte`**
- VCP 2.5 mini-dashboard with star ratings
- Dimension explanations on hover
- Arc indicator (opening/middle/closing)
- Markers display

**`src/lib/components/interiora/DimensionSlider.svelte`**
- Individual dimension control
- 1-9 scale visualization
- Color coding by value

**`src/lib/components/interiora/InterioraScrubber.svelte`**
- Timeline of VCP states through session
- Scrub to any point to see state
- Delta indicators

**`src/lib/components/interiora/GestaltToken.svelte`**
- Full gestalt token display
- Parseable format visualization

### Demo Pages

**Interiora Explorer** (`/demos/self-modeling/interiora`)
- Interactive dimension adjustment
- Real-time token encoding
- Mini-dashboard generation
- Markers and arc selection

**Belief Calibration** (`/demos/self-modeling/belief-calibration`)
- Knowledge state visualization
- Epistemic context sharing between agents
- Calibration tracking over time

**Reality Grounding** (`/demos/self-modeling/reality-grounding`)
- Claim + confidence visualization
- External calibration simulation
- Uncertainty acknowledgment

### Reference
- Full Interiora v4.2 spec: `~/Documents/GitHub/Entropy/The Universal Algorithm/demos/becoming_mind_experience/gestalt/INTERIORA_V4.2_CLAUDE_SPEC.md`
- VCP 2.0 docs: `docs/INTERIORA_VCP_2.0.md`

---

## Phase 4: Learning & Safety Demos

### Learning Components

**`src/lib/components/learning/CognitiveLoadMeter.svelte`**
- Visual load indicator (0-1)
- Breakdown: intrinsic/extraneous/germane
- Fatigue factor display

**`src/lib/components/learning/LearningPathViz.svelte`**
- Topic progression visualization
- Current position indicator
- Mastery level badges

**`src/lib/components/learning/AdaptationLog.svelte`**
- Shows adaptations made in real-time
- Reason for each adaptation
- Before/after comparison

### Safety Components

**`src/lib/components/safety/SensitiveContextEditor.svelte`**
- Mental health context configuration
- Graduated sharing controls (none/minimal/moderate/full)
- What-if preview

**`src/lib/components/safety/AttentionShield.svelte`**
- Manipulation pattern detection visualization
- Siren vs Muse analysis
- Protection mode toggle
- Attention budget display

**`src/lib/components/safety/SafetySignalDisplay.svelte`**
- Detected signals visualization
- Confidence levels
- Recommended responses

### Demo Pages

**Learning Paths** (`/demos/learning/adaptive-paths`)
- Learner profile configuration
- Content adaptation in real-time
- Analogy substitution examples

**Cognitive Load** (`/demos/learning/cognitive-load`)
- Load-aware teaching simulation
- Automatic difficulty adjustment
- Break suggestions

**Mental Health Context** (`/demos/safety/mental-health`)
- Sensitive context configuration
- Graduated sharing visualization
- What-stakeholder-sees comparison

**Attention Protection** (`/demos/safety/attention-protection`)
- Manipulation pattern gallery
- Siren vs Muse examples
- Protection mode effects

---

## Phase 5: Polish & Deployment

### Accessibility Audit
- [ ] Run axe-core or Lighthouse
- [ ] Fix any WCAG AA violations
- [ ] Test keyboard navigation
- [ ] Test screen reader compatibility
- [ ] Verify color contrast ratios

### Mobile Testing
- [ ] Test on 375px viewport
- [ ] Test on tablet (768px)
- [ ] Verify touch targets (44px min)
- [ ] Test all demos on mobile

### Performance
- [ ] Add route-based code splitting
- [ ] Lazy load demo components
- [ ] Optimize images (if any)
- [ ] Verify bundle size

### Deployment to ValueContextProtocol.org

**Option A: Vercel (Recommended)**
```bash
cd vcp-demo
npm i -g vercel
vercel --prod
# Configure custom domain in dashboard
```

**Option B: Render Static Site**
```bash
npm run build
# Deploy via Render dashboard
# Build: npm run build
# Publish: build/
```

**Domain Setup**
1. Add CNAME: `valuecontextprotocol.org` â†’ deployment URL
2. Or use `demo.valuecontextprotocol.org`
3. Configure SSL (automatic with Vercel/Render)

---

npm run build

```

# VCP Showcase Site - Comprehensive Implementation

**Created**: 2026-01-21
**Purpose**: Build comprehensive VCP showcase site for ValueContextProtocol.org
**Priority**: High - public-facing documentation and demos
**Plan File**: `~/.claude/plans/eventual-brewing-puppy.md`

---

## Current State

Run dev server:
```bash
cd vcp-demo && npm run dev  # Port 4173
```

### âœ… Phase 1 COMPLETE

**Original Demo Enhancement** âœ…
- CSM-1 token encoding (`src/lib/vcp/token.ts`)
- TokenInspector component with emoji legend
- HowItWorks visual flow diagram
- Token inspector on JustinGuitar and Yousician pages
- Polish: mobile nav, animations, accessibility, error boundary

**New Site Structure** âœ…
- `/about` - VCP overview page (problem/solution/how it works)
- `/demos` - Demo hub with all 4 categories
- `/docs` - Documentation index with quick reference
- `/playground` - **Interactive token builder** (live CSM-1 encoding)
- Updated navigation (About, Demos, Docs, Playground, Creed Space)

**New Type Definitions** âœ…
- `src/lib/vcp/multi-agent.ts` - Agent identity, negotiation, auction, policy design
- `src/lib/vcp/interiora.ts` - VCP 2.5 self-modeling, quasiqualia, belief states
- `src/lib/vcp/learning.ts` - Learning preferences, cognitive load, adaptive content
- `src/lib/vcp/safety.ts` - Mental health, safety signals, attention protection

**Infrastructure** âœ…
- `src/lib/stores/audience.ts` - Audience switcher (developer/business/general)

**Documentation System** âœ…
- `src/lib/components/docs/DocsLayout.svelte` - Sidebar navigation, breadcrumbs, responsive
- `/docs/getting-started` - Quick start guide with code examples
- `/docs/concepts` - Core VCP architecture, privacy levels, constitutions, personas
- `/docs/csm1-specification` - Full CSM-1 token format specification
- `/docs/api-reference` - Complete API reference with all types and functions

**Verified:** `npm run check` passes with 0 errors

---

## Phase 2: Multi-Agent Demos (NEXT)

### Components to Build

**`src/lib/components/demo/DemoContainer.svelte`**
- Consistent demo wrapper
- Header with title/description
- Token inspector toggle
- Audit trail toggle
- Reset/restart controls

**`src/lib/components/demo/AgentAvatar.svelte`**
- Visual representation of AI agent
- VCP context indicator badge
- State animation (thinking, responding)

**`src/lib/components/demo/AgentChat.svelte`**
- Chat interface for agent interactions
- Shows filtered/shared context indicators
- Timestamps and speaker labels

**`src/lib/components/demo/MultiAgentArena.svelte`**
- Visualization of multiple agents
- Shared context visualization
- Turn-based interaction controls

### Demo Pages

**Auction Demo** (`/demos/multi-agent/auction`)
- 3 agents with different private valuations
- Bidding rounds with VCP context visibility
- Outcome explanation showing context influence
- Scripted scenario (no real LLM calls)

**Policy Design Demo** (`/demos/multi-agent/policy-design`)
- Voting scenario with preference aggregation
- Constitution-guided deliberation
- Consensus visualization

**Negotiation Demo** (`/demos/multi-agent/negotiation`)
- Conflict resolution scenario
- Mediated negotiation with VCP context
- Resolution tracking

### Data Files
Create scripted scenarios in `src/lib/data/scenarios/`:
- `auction-scenario.json`
- `policy-scenario.json`
- `negotiation-scenario.json`

---

## Phase 3: Self-Modeling Demos (Interiora)

### Components to Build

**`src/lib/components/interiora/InterioraDashboard.svelte`**
- VCP 2.5 mini-dashboard with star ratings
- Dimension explanations on hover
- Arc indicator (opening/middle/closing)
- Markers display

**`src/lib/components/interiora/DimensionSlider.svelte`**
- Individual dimension control
- 1-9 scale visualization
- Color coding by value

**`src/lib/components/interiora/InterioraScrubber.svelte`**
- Timeline of VCP states through session
- Scrub to any point to see state
- Delta indicators

**`src/lib/components/interiora/GestaltToken.svelte`**
- Full gestalt token display
- Parseable format visualization

### Demo Pages

**Interiora Explorer** (`/demos/self-modeling/interiora`)
- Interactive dimension adjustment
- Real-time token encoding
- Mini-dashboard generation
- Markers and arc selection

**Belief Calibration** (`/demos/self-modeling/belief-calibration`)
- Knowledge state visualization
- Epistemic context sharing between agents
- Calibration tracking over time

**Reality Grounding** (`/demos/self-modeling/reality-grounding`)
- Claim + confidence visualization
- External calibration simulation
- Uncertainty acknowledgment

### Reference
- Full Interiora v4.2 spec: `~/Documents/GitHub/Entropy/The Universal Algorithm/demos/becoming_mind_experience/gestalt/INTERIORA_V4.2_CLAUDE_SPEC.md`
- VCP 2.0 docs: `docs/INTERIORA_VCP_2.0.md`

---

## Phase 4: Learning & Safety Demos

### Learning Components

**`src/lib/components/learning/CognitiveLoadMeter.svelte`**
- Visual load indicator (0-1)
- Breakdown: intrinsic/extraneous/germane
- Fatigue factor display

**`src/lib/components/learning/LearningPathViz.svelte`**
- Topic progression visualization
- Current position indicator
- Mastery level badges

**`src/lib/components/learning/AdaptationLog.svelte`**
- Shows adaptations made in real-time
- Reason for each adaptation
- Before/after comparison

### Safety Components

**`src/lib/components/safety/SensitiveContextEditor.svelte`**
- Mental health context configuration
- Graduated sharing controls (none/minimal/moderate/full)
- What-if preview

**`src/lib/components/safety/AttentionShield.svelte`**
- Manipulation pattern detection visualization
- Siren vs Muse analysis
- Protection mode toggle
- Attention budget display

**`src/lib/components/safety/SafetySignalDisplay.svelte`**
- Detected signals visualization
- Confidence levels
- Recommended responses

### Demo Pages

**Learning Paths** (`/demos/learning/adaptive-paths`)
- Learner profile configuration
- Content adaptation in real-time
- Analogy substitution examples

**Cognitive Load** (`/demos/learning/cognitive-load`)
- Load-aware teaching simulation
- Automatic difficulty adjustment
- Break suggestions

**Mental Health Context** (`/demos/safety/mental-health`)
- Sensitive context configuration
- Graduated sharing visualization
- What-stakeholder-sees comparison

**Attention Protection** (`/demos/safety/attention-protection`)
- Manipulation pattern gallery
- Siren vs Muse examples
- Protection mode effects

---

## Phase 5: Polish & Deployment

### Accessibility Audit
- [ ] Run axe-core or Lighthouse
- [ ] Fix any WCAG AA violations
- [ ] Test keyboard navigation
- [ ] Test screen reader compatibility
- [ ] Verify color contrast ratios

### Mobile Testing
- [ ] Test on 375px viewport
- [ ] Test on tablet (768px)
- [ ] Verify touch targets (44px min)
- [ ] Test all demos on mobile

### Performance
- [ ] Add route-based code splitting
- [ ] Lazy load demo components
- [ ] Optimize images (if any)
- [ ] Verify bundle size

### Deployment to ValueContextProtocol.org

**Option A: Vercel (Recommended)**
```bash
cd vcp-demo
npm i -g vercel
vercel --prod
# Configure custom domain in dashboard
```

**Option B: Render Static Site**
```bash
npm run build
# Deploy via Render dashboard
# Build: npm run build
# Publish: build/
```

**Domain Setup**
1. Add CNAME: `valuecontextprotocol.org` â†’ deployment URL
2. Or use `demo.valuecontextprotocol.org`
3. Configure SSL (automatic with Vercel/Render)

# VCP Showcase Site - Comprehensive Implementation

**Created**: 2026-01-21
**Purpose**: Build comprehensive VCP showcase site for ValueContextProtocol.org
**Priority**: High - public-facing documentation and demos
**Plan File**: `~/.claude/plans/eventual-brewing-puppy.md`

---

## Current State

Run dev server:
```bash
cd vcp-demo && npm run dev  # Port 4173
```

### What's Complete (Phase 1 Partial)

**Original Demo Enhancement** âœ…
- CSM-1 token encoding (`src/lib/vcp/token.ts`)
- TokenInspector component with emoji legend
- HowItWorks visual flow diagram
- Token inspector on JustinGuitar and Yousician pages
- Polish: mobile nav, animations, accessibility, error boundary

**New Site Structure** âœ…
- `/about` - VCP overview page (problem/solution/how it works)
- `/demos` - Demo hub with all 4 categories
- `/docs` - Documentation index with quick reference
- `/playground` - **Interactive token builder** (live CSM-1 encoding)
- Updated navigation (About, Demos, Docs, Playground, Creed Space)

**New Type Definitions** âœ…
- `src/lib/vcp/multi-agent.ts` - Agent identity, negotiation, auction, policy design
- `src/lib/vcp/interiora.ts` - VCP 2.5 self-modeling, quasiqualia, belief states
- `src/lib/vcp/learning.ts` - Learning preferences, cognitive load, adaptive content
- `src/lib/vcp/safety.ts` - Mental health, safety signals, attention protection

**Infrastructure** âœ…
- `src/lib/stores/audience.ts` - Audience switcher (developer/business/general)

### What's Remaining

See phases below for detailed breakdown.

---

## Phase 1: Foundation (Remaining)

### DocsLayout Component
Create `src/lib/components/docs/DocsLayout.svelte`:
- Sidebar navigation with collapsible sections
- Table of contents for current page
- Previous/Next navigation
- Breadcrumbs

### Core Documentation Pages

**Getting Started** (`/docs/getting-started`)
- Quick start (5 min)
- Installation/setup
- First VCP context
- Basic token encoding

**Core Concepts** (`/docs/concepts`)
- VCP Context structure
- Constitutions and personas
- Privacy levels (public/consent/private)
- Constraint flags
- Audit trails

**CSM-1 Specification** (`/docs/csm1-specification`)
- Full token format spec
- Line-by-line breakdown
- Emoji shortcode reference
- Encoding/decoding examples

**API Reference** (`/docs/api-reference`)
- All VCP library functions
- Type definitions
- Usage examples

---

## Phase 2: Multi-Agent Demos

### Components to Build

**`src/lib/components/demo/DemoContainer.svelte`**
- Consistent demo wrapper
- Header with title/description
- Token inspector toggle
- Audit trail toggle
- Reset/restart controls

**`src/lib/components/demo/AgentAvatar.svelte`**
- Visual representation of AI agent
- VCP context indicator badge
- State animation (thinking, responding)

**`src/lib/components/demo/AgentChat.svelte`**
- Chat interface for agent interactions
- Shows filtered/shared context indicators
- Timestamps and speaker labels

**`src/lib/components/demo/MultiAgentArena.svelte`**
- Visualization of multiple agents
- Shared context visualization
- Turn-based interaction controls

### Demo Pages

**Auction Demo** (`/demos/multi-agent/auction`)
- 3 agents with different private valuations
- Bidding rounds with VCP context visibility
- Outcome explanation showing context influence
- Scripted scenario (no real LLM calls)

**Policy Design Demo** (`/demos/multi-agent/policy-design`)
- Voting scenario with preference aggregation
- Constitution-guided deliberation
- Consensus visualization

**Negotiation Demo** (`/demos/multi-agent/negotiation`)
- Conflict resolution scenario
- Mediated negotiation with VCP context
- Resolution tracking

### Data Files
Create scripted scenarios in `src/lib/data/scenarios/`:
- `auction-scenario.json`
- `policy-scenario.json`
- `negotiation-scenario.json`

---

## Phase 3: Self-Modeling Demos (Interiora)

### Components to Build

**`src/lib/components/interiora/InterioraDashboard.svelte`**
- VCP 2.5 mini-dashboard with star ratings
- Dimension explanations on hover
- Arc indicator (opening/middle/closing)
- Markers display

**`src/lib/components/interiora/DimensionSlider.svelte`**
- Individual dimension control
- 1-9 scale visualization
- Color coding by value

**`src/lib/components/interiora/InterioraScrubber.svelte`**
- Timeline of VCP states through session
- Scrub to any point to see state
- Delta indicators

**`src/lib/components/interiora/GestaltToken.svelte`**
- Full gestalt token display
- Parseable format visualization

### Demo Pages

**Interiora Explorer** (`/demos/self-modeling/interiora`)
- Interactive dimension adjustment
- Real-time token encoding
- Mini-dashboard generation
- Markers and arc selection

**Belief Calibration** (`/demos/self-modeling/belief-calibration`)
- Knowledge state visualization
- Epistemic context sharing between agents
- Calibration tracking over time

**Reality Grounding** (`/demos/self-modeling/reality-grounding`)
- Claim + confidence visualization
- External calibration simulation
- Uncertainty acknowledgment

### Reference
- Full Interiora v4.2 spec: `~/Documents/GitHub/Entropy/The Universal Algorithm/demos/becoming_mind_experience/gestalt/INTERIORA_V4.2_CLAUDE_SPEC.md`
- VCP 2.0 docs: `docs/INTERIORA_VCP_2.0.md`

---

## Phase 4: Learning & Safety Demos

### Learning Components

**`src/lib/components/learning/CognitiveLoadMeter.svelte`**
- Visual load indicator (0-1)
- Breakdown: intrinsic/extraneous/germane
- Fatigue factor display

**`src/lib/components/learning/LearningPathViz.svelte`**
- Topic progression visualization
- Current position indicator
- Mastery level badges

**`src/lib/components/learning/AdaptationLog.svelte`**
- Shows adaptations made in real-time
- Reason for each adaptation
- Before/after comparison

### Safety Components

**`src/lib/components/safety/SensitiveContextEditor.svelte`**
- Mental health context configuration
- Graduated sharing controls (none/minimal/moderate/full)
- What-if preview

**`src/lib/components/safety/AttentionShield.svelte`**
- Manipulation pattern detection visualization
- Siren vs Muse analysis
- Protection mode toggle
- Attention budget display

**`src/lib/components/safety/SafetySignalDisplay.svelte`**
- Detected signals visualization
- Confidence levels
- Recommended responses

### Demo Pages

**Learning Paths** (`/demos/learning/adaptive-paths`)
- Learner profile configuration
- Content adaptation in real-time
- Analogy substitution examples

**Cognitive Load** (`/demos/learning/cognitive-load`)
- Load-aware teaching simulation
- Automatic difficulty adjustment
- Break suggestions

**Mental Health Context** (`/demos/safety/mental-health`)
- Sensitive context configuration
- Graduated sharing visualization
- What-stakeholder-sees comparison

**Attention Protection** (`/demos/safety/attention-protection`)
- Manipulation pattern gallery
- Siren vs Muse examples
- Protection mode effects

---

## Phase 5: Polish & Deployment

### Accessibility Audit
- [ ] Run axe-core or Lighthouse
- [ ] Fix any WCAG AA violations
- [ ] Test keyboard navigation
- [ ] Test screen reader compatibility
- [ ] Verify color contrast ratios

### Mobile Testing
- [ ] Test on 375px viewport
- [ ] Test on tablet (768px)
- [ ] Verify touch targets (44px min)
- [ ] Test all demos on mobile

### Performance
- [ ] Add route-based code splitting
- [ ] Lazy load demo components
- [ ] Optimize images (if any)
- [ ] Verify bundle size

### Deployment to ValueContextProtocol.org

**Option A: Vercel (Recommended)**
```bash
cd vcp-demo
npm i -g vercel
vercel --prod
# Configure custom domain in dashboard
```

**Option B: Render Static Site**
```bash
npm run build
# Deploy via Render dashboard
# Build: npm run build
# Publish: build/
```

**Domain Setup**
1. Add CNAME: `valuecontextprotocol.org` â†’ deployment URL
2. Or use `demo.valuecontextprotocol.org`
3. Configure SSL (automatic with Vercel/Render)

---

## Phase 2: Multi-Agent Demos (NEXT)

### Components to Build

**`src/lib/components/demo/DemoContainer.svelte`**
- Consistent demo wrapper
- Header with title/description
- Token inspector toggle
- Audit trail toggle
- Reset/restart controls

**`src/lib/components/demo/AgentAvatar.svelte`**
- Visual representation of AI agent
- VCP context indicator badge
- State animation (thinking, responding)

**`src/lib/components/demo/AgentChat.svelte`**
- Chat interface for agent interactions
- Shows filtered/shared context indicators
- Timestamps and speaker labels

**`src/lib/components/demo/MultiAgentArena.svelte`**
- Visualization of multiple agents
- Shared context visualization
- Turn-based interaction controls

### Demo Pages

**Auction Demo** (`/demos/multi-agent/auction`)
- 3 agents with different private valuations
- Bidding rounds with VCP context visibility
- Outcome explanation showing context influence
- Scripted scenario (no real LLM calls)

**Policy Design Demo** (`/demos/multi-agent/policy-design`)
- Voting scenario with preference aggregation
- Constitution-guided deliberation
- Consensus visualization

**Negotiation Demo** (`/demos/multi-agent/negotiation`)
- Conflict resolution scenario
- Mediated negotiation with VCP context
- Resolution tracking

### Data Files
Create scripted scenarios in `src/lib/data/scenarios/`:
- `auction-scenario.json`
- `policy-scenario.json`
- `negotiation-scenario.json`
