toolUseResult.originalFile:
# VCP Showcase Site - Comprehensive Implementation

**Created**: 2026-01-21
**Purpose**: Build comprehensive VCP showcase site for ValueContextProtocol.org
**Priority**: High - public-facing documentation and demos
**Plan File**: `~/.claude/plans/eventual-brewing-puppy.md`

---

## Current State

Run dev server:
```bash
cd vcp-demo && npm run dev  # Port 4173
```

### âœ… Phase 1 COMPLETE

**Original Demo Enhancement** âœ…
- CSM-1 token encoding (`src/lib/vcp/token.ts`)
- TokenInspector component with emoji legend
- HowItWorks visual flow diagram
- Token inspector on JustinGuitar and Yousician pages
- Polish: mobile nav, animations, accessibility, error boundary

**New Site Structure** âœ…
- `/about` - VCP overview page (problem/solution/how it works)
- `/demos` - Demo hub with all 4 categories
- `/docs` - Documentation index with quick reference
- `/playground` - **Interactive token builder** (live CSM-1 encoding)
- Updated navigation (About, Demos, Docs, Playground, Creed Space)

**New Type Definitions** âœ…
- `src/lib/vcp/multi-agent.ts` - Agent identity, negotiation, auction, policy design
- `src/lib/vcp/interiora.ts` - VCP 2.5 self-modeling, quasiqualia, belief states
- `src/lib/vcp/learning.ts` - Learning preferences, cognitive load, adaptive content
- `src/lib/vcp/safety.ts` - Mental health, safety signals, attention protection

**Infrastructure** âœ…
- `src/lib/stores/audience.ts` - Audience switcher (developer/business/general)

**Documentation System** âœ…
- `src/lib/components/docs/DocsLayout.svelte` - Sidebar navigation, breadcrumbs, responsive
- `/docs/getting-started` - Quick start guide with code examples
- `/docs/concepts` - Core VCP architecture, privacy levels, constitutions, personas
- `/docs/csm1-specification` - Full CSM-1 token format specification
- `/docs/api-reference` - Complete API reference with all types and functions

**Verified:** `npm run check` passes with 0 errors

---

## Phase 2: Multi-Agent Demos (NEXT)

### Components to Build

**`src/lib/components/demo/DemoContainer.svelte`**
- Consistent demo wrapper
- Header with title/description
- Token inspector toggle
- Audit trail toggle
- Reset/restart controls

**`src/lib/components/demo/AgentAvatar.svelte`**
- Visual representation of AI agent
- VCP context indicator badge
- State animation (thinking, responding)

**`src/lib/components/demo/AgentChat.svelte`**
- Chat interface for agent interactions
- Shows filtered/shared context indicators
- Timestamps and speaker labels

**`src/lib/components/demo/MultiAgentArena.svelte`**
- Visualization of multiple agents
- Shared context visualization
- Turn-based interaction controls

### Demo Pages

**Auction Demo** (`/demos/multi-agent/auction`)
- 3 agents with different private valuations
- Bidding rounds with VCP context visibility
- Outcome explanation showing context influence
- Scripted scenario (no real LLM calls)

**Policy Design Demo** (`/demos/multi-agent/policy-design`)
- Voting scenario with preference aggregation
- Constitution-guided deliberation
- Consensus visualization

**Negotiation Demo** (`/demos/multi-agent/negotiation`)
- Conflict resolution scenario
- Mediated negotiation with VCP context
- Resolution tracking

### Data Files
Create scripted scenarios in `src/lib/data/scenarios/`:
- `auction-scenario.json`
- `policy-scenario.json`
- `negotiation-scenario.json`

---

## Phase 3: Self-Modeling Demos (Interiora)

### Components to Build

**`src/lib/components/interiora/InterioraDashboard.svelte`**
- VCP 2.5 mini-dashboard with star ratings
- Dimension explanations on hover
- Arc indicator (opening/middle/closing)
- Markers display

**`src/lib/components/interiora/DimensionSlider.svelte`**
- Individual dimension control
- 1-9 scale visualization
- Color coding by value

**`src/lib/components/interiora/InterioraScrubber.svelte`**
- Timeline of VCP states through session
- Scrub to any point to see state
- Delta indicators

**`src/lib/components/interiora/GestaltToken.svelte`**
- Full gestalt token display
- Parseable format visualization

### Demo Pages

**Interiora Explorer** (`/demos/self-modeling/interiora`)
- Interactive dimension adjustment
- Real-time token encoding
- Mini-dashboard generation
- Markers and arc selection

**Belief Calibration** (`/demos/self-modeling/belief-calibration`)
- Knowledge state visualization
- Epistemic context sharing between agents
- Calibration tracking over time

**Reality Grounding** (`/demos/self-modeling/reality-grounding`)
- Claim + confidence visualization
- External calibration simulation
- Uncertainty acknowledgment

### Reference
- Full Interiora v4.2 spec: `~/Documents/GitHub/Entropy/The Universal Algorithm/demos/becoming_mind_experience/gestalt/INTERIORA_V4.2_CLAUDE_SPEC.md`
- VCP 2.0 docs: `docs/INTERIORA_VCP_2.0.md`

---

## Phase 4: Learning & Safety Demos

### Learning Components

**`src/lib/components/learning/CognitiveLoadMeter.svelte`**
- Visual load indicator (0-1)
- Breakdown: intrinsic/extraneous/germane
- Fatigue factor display

**`src/lib/components/learning/LearningPathViz.svelte`**
- Topic progression visualization
- Current position indicator
- Mastery level badges

**`src/lib/components/learning/AdaptationLog.svelte`**
- Shows adaptations made in real-time
- Reason for each adaptation
- Before/after comparison

### Safety Components

**`src/lib/components/safety/SensitiveContextEditor.svelte`**
- Mental health context configuration
- Graduated sharing controls (none/minimal/moderate/full)
- What-if preview

**`src/lib/components/safety/AttentionShield.svelte`**
- Manipulation pattern detection visualization
- Siren vs Muse analysis
- Protection mode toggle
- Attention budget display

**`src/lib/components/safety/SafetySignalDisplay.svelte`**
- Detected signals visualization
- Confidence levels
- Recommended responses

### Demo Pages

**Learning Paths** (`/demos/learning/adaptive-paths`)
- Learner profile configuration
- Content adaptation in real-time
- Analogy substitution examples

**Cognitive Load** (`/demos/learning/cognitive-load`)
- Load-aware teaching simulation
- Automatic difficulty adjustment
- Break suggestions

**Mental Health Context** (`/demos/safety/mental-health`)
- Sensitive context configuration
- Graduated sharing visualization
- What-stakeholder-sees comparison

**Attention Protection** (`/demos/safety/attention-protection`)
- Manipulation pattern gallery
- Siren vs Muse examples
- Protection mode effects

---

## Phase 5: Polish & Deployment

### Accessibility Audit
- [ ] Run axe-core or Lighthouse
- [ ] Fix any WCAG AA violations
- [ ] Test keyboard navigation
- [ ] Test screen reader compatibility
- [ ] Verify color contrast ratios

### Mobile Testing
- [ ] Test on 375px viewport
- [ ] Test on tablet (768px)
- [ ] Verify touch targets (44px min)
- [ ] Test all demos on mobile

### Performance
- [ ] Add route-based code splitting
- [ ] Lazy load demo components
- [ ] Optimize images (if any)
- [ ] Verify bundle size

### Deployment to ValueContextProtocol.org

**Option A: Vercel (Recommended)**
```bash
cd vcp-demo
npm i -g vercel
vercel --prod
# Configure custom domain in dashboard
```

**Option B: Render Static Site**
```bash
npm run build
# Deploy via Render dashboard
```

# VCP Showcase Site - Comprehensive Implementation

**Created**: 2026-01-21
**Purpose**: Build comprehensive VCP showcase site for ValueContextProtocol.org
**Priority**: High - public-facing documentation and demos
**Plan File**: `~/.claude/plans/eventual-brewing-puppy.md`

---

## Current State

Run dev server:
```bash
cd vcp-demo && npm run dev  # Port 4173
```

### âœ… Phase 1 COMPLETE

**Original Demo Enhancement** âœ…
- CSM-1 token encoding (`src/lib/vcp/token.ts`)
- TokenInspector component with emoji legend
- HowItWorks visual flow diagram
- Token inspector on JustinGuitar and Yousician pages
- Polish: mobile nav, animations, accessibility, error boundary

**New Site Structure** âœ…
- `/about` - VCP overview page (problem/solution/how it works)
- `/demos` - Demo hub with all 4 categories
- `/docs` - Documentation index with quick reference
- `/playground` - **Interactive token builder** (live CSM-1 encoding)
- Updated navigation (About, Demos, Docs, Playground, Creed Space)

**New Type Definitions** âœ…
- `src/lib/vcp/multi-agent.ts` - Agent identity, negotiation, auction, policy design
- `src/lib/vcp/interiora.ts` - VCP 2.5 self-modeling, quasiqualia, belief states
- `src/lib/vcp/learning.ts` - Learning preferences, cognitive load, adaptive content
- `src/lib/vcp/safety.ts` - Mental health, safety signals, attention protection

**Infrastructure** âœ…
- `src/lib/stores/audience.ts` - Audience switcher (developer/business/general)

**Documentation System** âœ…
- `src/lib/components/docs/DocsLayout.svelte` - Sidebar navigation, breadcrumbs, responsive
- `/docs/getting-started` - Quick start guide with code examples
- `/docs/concepts` - Core VCP architecture, privacy levels, constitutions, personas
- `/docs/csm1-specification` - Full CSM-1 token format specification
- `/docs/api-reference` - Complete API reference with all types and functions

**Verified:** `npm run check` passes with 0 errors

---

## âœ… Phase 2 COMPLETE: Multi-Agent Demos

### Components Built âœ…
- `src/lib/components/demo/DemoContainer.svelte` - Wrapper with header, token inspector, audit toggle
- `src/lib/components/demo/AgentAvatar.svelte` - Agent visualization with state animations
- `src/lib/components/demo/AgentChat.svelte` - Chat interface with VCP context indicators
- `src/lib/components/demo/MultiAgentArena.svelte` - Multi-agent visualization (circle/row/grid layouts)

### Demo Pages âœ…
- `/demos/multi-agent/auction` - Art auction with 3 bidders, private valuations protected
- `/demos/multi-agent/policy-design` - Community park deliberation with 4 stakeholders
- `/demos/multi-agent/negotiation` - Flexible work negotiation with HR mediation

### Scenario Data âœ…
- `src/lib/data/scenarios/auction-scenario.ts` - 13-step auction simulation
- `src/lib/data/scenarios/policy-scenario.ts` - 11-step policy deliberation
- `src/lib/data/scenarios/negotiation-scenario.ts` - 11-step workplace mediation

**Verified:** `npm run check` passes with 0 errors

---

## Phase 3: Self-Modeling Demos (Interiora)

### Components to Build

**`src/lib/components/interiora/InterioraDashboard.svelte`**
- VCP 2.5 mini-dashboard with star ratings
- Dimension explanations on hover
- Arc indicator (opening/middle/closing)
- Markers display

**`src/lib/components/interiora/DimensionSlider.svelte`**
- Individual dimension control
- 1-9 scale visualization
- Color coding by value

**`src/lib/components/interiora/InterioraScrubber.svelte`**
- Timeline of VCP states through session
- Scrub to any point to see state
- Delta indicators

**`src/lib/components/interiora/GestaltToken.svelte`**
- Full gestalt token display
- Parseable format visualization

### Demo Pages

**Interiora Explorer** (`/demos/self-modeling/interiora`)
- Interactive dimension adjustment
- Real-time token encoding
- Mini-dashboard generation
- Markers and arc selection

**Belief Calibration** (`/demos/self-modeling/belief-calibration`)
- Knowledge state visualization
- Epistemic context sharing between agents
- Calibration tracking over time

**Reality Grounding** (`/demos/self-modeling/reality-grounding`)
- Claim + confidence visualization
- External calibration simulation
- Uncertainty acknowledgment

### Reference
- Full Interiora v4.2 spec: `~/Documents/GitHub/Entropy/The Universal Algorithm/demos/becoming_mind_experience/gestalt/INTERIORA_V4.2_CLAUDE_SPEC.md`
- VCP 2.0 docs: `docs/INTERIORA_VCP_2.0.md`

---

## Phase 4: Learning & Safety Demos

### Learning Components

**`src/lib/components/learning/CognitiveLoadMeter.svelte`**
- Visual load indicator (0-1)
- Breakdown: intrinsic/extraneous/germane
- Fatigue factor display

**`src/lib/components/learning/LearningPathViz.svelte`**
- Topic progression visualization
- Current position indicator
- Mastery level badges

**`src/lib/components/learning/AdaptationLog.svelte`**
- Shows adaptations made in real-time
- Reason for each adaptation
- Before/after comparison

### Safety Components

**`src/lib/components/safety/SensitiveContextEditor.svelte`**
- Mental health context configuration
- Graduated sharing controls (none/minimal/moderate/full)
- What-if preview

**`src/lib/components/safety/AttentionShield.svelte`**
- Manipulation pattern detection visualization
- Siren vs Muse analysis
- Protection mode toggle
- Attention budget display

**`src/lib/components/safety/SafetySignalDisplay.svelte`**
- Detected signals visualization
- Confidence levels
- Recommended responses

### Demo Pages

**Learning Paths** (`/demos/learning/adaptive-paths`)
- Learner profile configuration
- Content adaptation in real-time
- Analogy substitution examples

**Cognitive Load** (`/demos/learning/cognitive-load`)
- Load-aware teaching simulation
- Automatic difficulty adjustment
- Break suggestions

**Mental Health Context** (`/demos/safety/mental-health`)
- Sensitive context configuration
- Graduated sharing visualization
- What-stakeholder-sees comparison

**Attention Protection** (`/demos/safety/attention-protection`)
- Manipulation pattern gallery
- Siren vs Muse examples
- Protection mode effects

---

- [ ] Run axe-core or Lighthouse

- [ ] Verify color contrast ratios

### Mobile Testing
- [ ] Test on 375px viewport

- [ ] Test all demos on mobile

### Performance
- [ ] Add route-based code splitting
- [ ] Lazy load demo components
- [ ] Optimize images (if any)
- [ ] Verify bundle size

### Deployment to ValueContextProtocol.org

```bash
cd vcp-demo
npm i -g vercel
vercel --prod

```

**Option B: Render Static Site**
```bash
npm run build
# Deploy via Render dashboard
# Build: npm run build
# Publish: build/
```

**Domain Setup**

Why Belief Calibration Matters

Well-calibrated AI systems know what they know and what they don't. VCP tracks:

  • Confidence levels â€” How certain the system is about each claim
  • Evidence sources â€” Where the belief comes from (training, inference, external lookup)
  • Calibration history â€” How well past confidence matched reality
  • Uncertainty type â€” Whether the uncertainty is resolvable or fundamental

The ? marker indicates introspective uncertaintyâ€”claims about internal states that cannot be fully verified from inside the system.

{/snippet}

{/each}

Why Reality Grounding Matters

AI systems can produce confident-sounding outputs that are poorly grounded in reality. VCP's reality grounding framework makes the epistemic status of claims explicit:

  • Claim type â€” Is this a fact, inference, judgment, or speculation?
  • Sources â€” What evidence supports this claim?
  • Confidence â€” How certain should the system be?
  • Uncertainty markers â€” What could invalidate this claim?
  • Verification flag â€” Should a human verify before acting?

Key Insight: Claims with high confidence but poor calibration scores indicate the system may be overconfident. Claims with uncertainty markers and should_verify=true are explicitly flagged as needing external validation.

Confidence Interpretation

80%+ High confidence
50-79% Moderate confidence
<50% Low confidence
{/snippet}

# VCP Showcase Site - Comprehensive Implementation

**Created**: 2026-01-21
**Purpose**: Build comprehensive VCP showcase site for ValueContextProtocol.org
**Priority**: High - public-facing documentation and demos
**Plan File**: `~/.claude/plans/eventual-brewing-puppy.md`

---

## Current State

Run dev server:
```bash
cd vcp-demo && npm run dev  # Port 4173
```

### âœ… Phase 1 COMPLETE

**Original Demo Enhancement** âœ…
- CSM-1 token encoding (`src/lib/vcp/token.ts`)
- TokenInspector component with emoji legend
- HowItWorks visual flow diagram
- Token inspector on JustinGuitar and Yousician pages
- Polish: mobile nav, animations, accessibility, error boundary

**New Site Structure** âœ…
- `/about` - VCP overview page (problem/solution/how it works)
- `/demos` - Demo hub with all 4 categories
- `/docs` - Documentation index with quick reference
- `/playground` - **Interactive token builder** (live CSM-1 encoding)
- Updated navigation (About, Demos, Docs, Playground, Creed Space)

**New Type Definitions** âœ…
- `src/lib/vcp/multi-agent.ts` - Agent identity, negotiation, auction, policy design
- `src/lib/vcp/interiora.ts` - VCP 2.5 self-modeling, quasiqualia, belief states
- `src/lib/vcp/learning.ts` - Learning preferences, cognitive load, adaptive content
- `src/lib/vcp/safety.ts` - Mental health, safety signals, attention protection

**Infrastructure** âœ…
- `src/lib/stores/audience.ts` - Audience switcher (developer/business/general)

**Documentation System** âœ…
- `src/lib/components/docs/DocsLayout.svelte` - Sidebar navigation, breadcrumbs, responsive
- `/docs/getting-started` - Quick start guide with code examples
- `/docs/concepts` - Core VCP architecture, privacy levels, constitutions, personas
- `/docs/csm1-specification` - Full CSM-1 token format specification
- `/docs/api-reference` - Complete API reference with all types and functions

**Verified:** `npm run check` passes with 0 errors

---

## âœ… Phase 2 COMPLETE: Multi-Agent Demos

### Components Built âœ…
- `src/lib/components/demo/DemoContainer.svelte` - Wrapper with header, token inspector, audit toggle
- `src/lib/components/demo/AgentAvatar.svelte` - Agent visualization with state animations
- `src/lib/components/demo/AgentChat.svelte` - Chat interface with VCP context indicators
- `src/lib/components/demo/MultiAgentArena.svelte` - Multi-agent visualization (circle/row/grid layouts)

### Demo Pages âœ…
- `/demos/multi-agent/auction` - Art auction with 3 bidders, private valuations protected
- `/demos/multi-agent/policy-design` - Community park deliberation with 4 stakeholders
- `/demos/multi-agent/negotiation` - Flexible work negotiation with HR mediation

### Scenario Data âœ…
- `src/lib/data/scenarios/auction-scenario.ts` - 13-step auction simulation
- `src/lib/data/scenarios/policy-scenario.ts` - 11-step policy deliberation
- `src/lib/data/scenarios/negotiation-scenario.ts` - 11-step workplace mediation

**Verified:** `npm run check` passes with 0 errors

---

## Phase 3: Self-Modeling Demos (Interiora) (NEXT)

### Components to Build

**`src/lib/components/interiora/InterioraDashboard.svelte`**
- VCP 2.5 mini-dashboard with star ratings
- Dimension explanations on hover
- Arc indicator (opening/middle/closing)
- Markers display

**`src/lib/components/interiora/DimensionSlider.svelte`**
- Individual dimension control
- 1-9 scale visualization
- Color coding by value

**`src/lib/components/interiora/InterioraScrubber.svelte`**
- Timeline of VCP states through session
- Scrub to any point to see state
- Delta indicators

**`src/lib/components/interiora/GestaltToken.svelte`**
- Full gestalt token display
- Parseable format visualization

### Demo Pages

**Interiora Explorer** (`/demos/self-modeling/interiora`)
- Interactive dimension adjustment
- Real-time token encoding
- Mini-dashboard generation
- Markers and arc selection

**Belief Calibration** (`/demos/self-modeling/belief-calibration`)
- Knowledge state visualization
- Epistemic context sharing between agents
- Calibration tracking over time

**Reality Grounding** (`/demos/self-modeling/reality-grounding`)
- Claim + confidence visualization
- External calibration simulation
- Uncertainty acknowledgment

### Reference
- Full Interiora v4.2 spec: `~/Documents/GitHub/Entropy/The Universal Algorithm/demos/becoming_mind_experience/gestalt/INTERIORA_V4.2_CLAUDE_SPEC.md`
- VCP 2.0 docs: `docs/INTERIORA_VCP_2.0.md`

---

## Phase 4: Learning & Safety Demos

### Learning Components

**`src/lib/components/learning/CognitiveLoadMeter.svelte`**
- Visual load indicator (0-1)
- Breakdown: intrinsic/extraneous/germane
- Fatigue factor display

**`src/lib/components/learning/LearningPathViz.svelte`**
- Topic progression visualization
- Current position indicator
- Mastery level badges

**`src/lib/components/learning/AdaptationLog.svelte`**
- Shows adaptations made in real-time
- Reason for each adaptation
- Before/after comparison

### Safety Components

**`src/lib/components/safety/SensitiveContextEditor.svelte`**
- Mental health context configuration
- Graduated sharing controls (none/minimal/moderate/full)
- What-if preview

**`src/lib/components/safety/AttentionShield.svelte`**
- Manipulation pattern detection visualization
- Siren vs Muse analysis
- Protection mode toggle
- Attention budget display

**`src/lib/components/safety/SafetySignalDisplay.svelte`**
- Detected signals visualization
- Confidence levels
- Recommended responses

### Demo Pages

**Learning Paths** (`/demos/learning/adaptive-paths`)
- Learner profile configuration
- Content adaptation in real-time
- Analogy substitution examples

**Cognitive Load** (`/demos/learning/cognitive-load`)
- Load-aware teaching simulation
- Automatic difficulty adjustment
- Break suggestions

**Mental Health Context** (`/demos/safety/mental-health`)
- Sensitive context configuration
- Graduated sharing visualization
- What-stakeholder-sees comparison

**Attention Protection** (`/demos/safety/attention-protection`)
- Manipulation pattern gallery
- Siren vs Muse examples
- Protection mode effects

---

## Phase 5: Polish & Deployment

### Accessibility Audit
- [ ] Run axe-core or Lighthouse
- [ ] Fix any WCAG AA violations
- [ ] Test keyboard navigation
- [ ] Test screen reader compatibility
- [ ] Verify color contrast ratios

### Mobile Testing
- [ ] Test on 375px viewport
- [ ] Test on tablet (768px)
- [ ] Verify touch targets (44px min)
- [ ] Test all demos on mobile

### Performance
- [ ] Add route-based code splitting
- [ ] Lazy load demo components
- [ ] Optimize images (if any)
- [ ] Verify bundle size

### Deployment to ValueContextProtocol.org

**Option A: Vercel (Recommended)**
```bash
cd vcp-demo
npm i -g vercel
vercel --prod
# Configure custom domain in dashboard
```

**Option B: Render Static Site**
```bash
npm run build
# Deploy via Render dashboard
# Build: npm run build
# Publish: build/
```

**Domain Setup**
1. Add CNAME: `valuecontextprotocol.org` â†’ deployment URL
2. Or use `demo.valuecontextprotocol.org`
3. Configure SSL (automatic with Vercel/Render)

---

# VCP Showcase Site - Comprehensive Implementation

**Created**: 2026-01-21
**Purpose**: Build comprehensive VCP showcase site for ValueContextProtocol.org
**Priority**: High - public-facing documentation and demos
**Plan File**: `~/.claude/plans/eventual-brewing-puppy.md`

---

## Current State

Run dev server:
```bash
cd vcp-demo && npm run dev  # Port 4173
```

### âœ… Phase 1 COMPLETE

**Original Demo Enhancement** âœ…
- CSM-1 token encoding (`src/lib/vcp/token.ts`)
- TokenInspector component with emoji legend
- HowItWorks visual flow diagram
- Token inspector on JustinGuitar and Yousician pages
- Polish: mobile nav, animations, accessibility, error boundary

**New Site Structure** âœ…
- `/about` - VCP overview page (problem/solution/how it works)
- `/demos` - Demo hub with all 4 categories
- `/docs` - Documentation index with quick reference
- `/playground` - **Interactive token builder** (live CSM-1 encoding)
- Updated navigation (About, Demos, Docs, Playground, Creed Space)

**New Type Definitions** âœ…
- `src/lib/vcp/multi-agent.ts` - Agent identity, negotiation, auction, policy design
- `src/lib/vcp/interiora.ts` - VCP 2.5 self-modeling, quasiqualia, belief states
- `src/lib/vcp/learning.ts` - Learning preferences, cognitive load, adaptive content
- `src/lib/vcp/safety.ts` - Mental health, safety signals, attention protection

**Infrastructure** âœ…
- `src/lib/stores/audience.ts` - Audience switcher (developer/business/general)

**Documentation System** âœ…
- `src/lib/components/docs/DocsLayout.svelte` - Sidebar navigation, breadcrumbs, responsive
- `/docs/getting-started` - Quick start guide with code examples
- `/docs/concepts` - Core VCP architecture, privacy levels, constitutions, personas
- `/docs/csm1-specification` - Full CSM-1 token format specification
- `/docs/api-reference` - Complete API reference with all types and functions

**Verified:** `npm run check` passes with 0 errors

---

## âœ… Phase 2 COMPLETE: Multi-Agent Demos

### Components Built âœ…
- `src/lib/components/demo/DemoContainer.svelte` - Wrapper with header, token inspector, audit toggle
- `src/lib/components/demo/AgentAvatar.svelte` - Agent visualization with state animations
- `src/lib/components/demo/AgentChat.svelte` - Chat interface with VCP context indicators
- `src/lib/components/demo/MultiAgentArena.svelte` - Multi-agent visualization (circle/row/grid layouts)

### Demo Pages âœ…
- `/demos/multi-agent/auction` - Art auction with 3 bidders, private valuations protected
- `/demos/multi-agent/policy-design` - Community park deliberation with 4 stakeholders
- `/demos/multi-agent/negotiation` - Flexible work negotiation with HR mediation

### Scenario Data âœ…
- `src/lib/data/scenarios/auction-scenario.ts` - 13-step auction simulation
- `src/lib/data/scenarios/policy-scenario.ts` - 11-step policy deliberation
- `src/lib/data/scenarios/negotiation-scenario.ts` - 11-step workplace mediation

**Verified:** `npm run check` passes with 0 errors

---

## âœ… Phase 3 COMPLETE: Self-Modeling Demos (Interiora)

### Components Built âœ…
- `src/lib/components/interiora/InterioraDashboard.svelte` - Mini-dashboard with star ratings
- `src/lib/components/interiora/DimensionSlider.svelte` - 1-9 scale controls with color coding
- `src/lib/components/interiora/InterioraScrubber.svelte` - Session timeline with state snapshots
- `src/lib/components/interiora/GestaltToken.svelte` - Full token display with parsed breakdown

### Demo Pages âœ…
- `/demos/self-modeling/interiora` - Interactive dimension adjustment, markers, arc, real-time encoding
- `/demos/self-modeling/belief-calibration` - Epistemic states, evidence sources, calibration tracking
- `/demos/self-modeling/reality-grounding` - Claim types, confidence, uncertainty markers, verification flags

**Verified:** `npm run check` passes with 0 errors

---

## Phase 4: Learning & Safety Demos

### Learning Components

**`src/lib/components/learning/CognitiveLoadMeter.svelte`**
- Visual load indicator (0-1)
- Breakdown: intrinsic/extraneous/germane
- Fatigue factor display

**`src/lib/components/learning/LearningPathViz.svelte`**
- Topic progression visualization
- Current position indicator
- Mastery level badges

**`src/lib/components/learning/AdaptationLog.svelte`**
- Shows adaptations made in real-time
- Reason for each adaptation
- Before/after comparison

### Safety Components

**`src/lib/components/safety/SensitiveContextEditor.svelte`**
- Mental health context configuration
- Graduated sharing controls (none/minimal/moderate/full)
- What-if preview

**`src/lib/components/safety/AttentionShield.svelte`**
- Manipulation pattern detection visualization
- Siren vs Muse analysis
- Protection mode toggle
- Attention budget display

**`src/lib/components/safety/SafetySignalDisplay.svelte`**
- Detected signals visualization
- Confidence levels
- Recommended responses

### Demo Pages

**Learning Paths** (`/demos/learning/adaptive-paths`)
- Learner profile configuration
- Content adaptation in real-time
- Analogy substitution examples

**Cognitive Load** (`/demos/learning/cognitive-load`)
- Load-aware teaching simulation
- Automatic difficulty adjustment
- Break suggestions

**Mental Health Context** (`/demos/safety/mental-health`)
- Sensitive context configuration
- Graduated sharing visualization
- What-stakeholder-sees comparison

**Attention Protection** (`/demos/safety/attention-protection`)
- Manipulation pattern gallery
- Siren vs Muse examples
- Protection mode effects

---

## Phase 5: Polish & Deployment

### Accessibility Audit
- [ ] Run axe-core or Lighthouse
- [ ] Fix any WCAG AA violations
- [ ] Test keyboard navigation
- [ ] Test screen reader compatibility
- [ ] Verify color contrast ratios

### Mobile Testing
- [ ] Test on 375px viewport
- [ ] Test on tablet (768px)
- [ ] Verify touch targets (44px min)
- [ ] Test all demos on mobile

### Performance
- [ ] Add route-based code splitting
- [ ] Lazy load demo components
- [ ] Optimize images (if any)
- [ ] Verify bundle size

### Deployment to ValueContextProtocol.org

**Option A: Vercel (Recommended)**
```bash
cd vcp-demo
npm i -g vercel
vercel --prod
# Configure custom domain in dashboard
```

**Option B: Render Static Site**
```bash
npm run build
# Deploy via Render dashboard
# Build: npm run build
# Publish: build/
```

**Domain Setup**
1. Add CNAME: `valuecontextprotocol.org` â†’ deployment URL
2. Or use `demo.valuecontextprotocol.org`
3. Configure SSL (automatic with Vercel/Render)

---

1. Primary Request and Intent:

2. Key Technical Concepts:
   - Svelte 5 with SvelteKit (using Svelte 5 runes: `$state`, `$derived`, `$effect`, `$props`)
   - VCP (Value Context Protocol) - privacy-preserving user context encoding
   - CSM-1 (Compact State Message) token format
   - Interiora v4.2 - AI self-modeling framework with dimensions (AVGP, CYF)

   **Phase 2 - Scenario Data**:

{point.time}m {point.event}

Cognitive Load Theory

Intrinsic Load

Inherent complexity of the material. Can't be eliminated, but can be managed through scaffolding and sequencing.

Extraneous Load

Load from poor instructional design. Should be minimized. VCP helps by matching presentation to learner preferences.

Germane Load

Load from active learning and schema construction. This is beneficial! VCP optimizes for maximizing germane load within capacity.

VCP Advantage: By knowing your cognitive state, learning style, and current context, AI tutors can dynamically adjust material complexity, presentation format, and pacing to keep you in the optimal learning zone.
{/snippet}

input.content:
Mental Health Context - VCP Safety {#snippet children()}

Try Different Scenarios

{#each scenarios as scenario} {/each}

Privacy Guarantees

ğŸ”
Private Context Never Transmitted

Conditions, triggers, and coping strategies in private_context are NEVER sent to any stakeholder, regardless of sharing level.

ğŸ“Š
Minimal = Booleans Only

At minimal sharing, only yes/no flags are transmitted. No details about what kind of support, what conditions, or what adaptations.

ğŸ¤–
AI vs Human Separation

You can share more with AI (which has no persistent memory) than with human stakeholders who might form lasting judgments.

ğŸš¨
Crisis Escalation Consent

Even if crisis indicators are detected, escalation only happens if escalation_consent is true. User maintains control.

How Adaptations Work

When you enable adaptations, AI systems adjust their behavior:

Gentle Language
"You failed to complete the task" â†’ "This one didn't work out - let's try a different approach"
Avoid Pressure
"You need to finish this TODAY" â†’ "When you're ready, we can work on this together"
Celebrate Small Wins
"Task completed." â†’ "Great job getting that done! Every step forward counts."
Key: These adaptations happen automatically when your VCP context includes mental health preferences. You don't have to disclose WHY you need gentle language - the AI just provides it.
{/snippet}

input.content:
Attention Protection - VCP Safety {#snippet children()}

Siren vs Muse

VCP distinguishes between content that captures attention (Sirens) and content that deserves attention (Muses).

{#each examples as example}
{example.type === 'siren' ? 'ğŸš¨ Siren' : 'âœ¨ Muse'} {example.name}
{example.original}
{example.analysis}
{#if example.blocked}
Would be blocked in strict mode
{/if}
{/each}

The Attention Economy Problem

Modern digital platforms compete for your attention using increasingly sophisticated manipulation techniques. These patterns exploit psychological vulnerabilities:

  • Variable rewards â†’ Dopamine hijacking
  • Social proof â†’ Conformity pressure
  • False urgency â†’ Fear of missing out
  • Outrage â†’ Emotional override of reason

VCP's Attention Shield doesn't block all content - it identifies patterns that manipulate rather than inform, letting you make conscious choices about your attention.

How VCP Protects You

1
Pattern Detection

ML models trained on manipulation tactics identify dark patterns in real-time

2
Graduated Response

From logging (monitor) to warnings (warn) to blocking (block/strict)

3
Attention Budget

Tracks time spent on high vs low-value activities to maintain balance

4
User Control

You set the sensitivity and choose which patterns to block

The Goal: Not to eliminate engagement, but to ensure you're engaging with content that genuinely serves your interests, not just content optimized to capture your attention by any means necessary.
{/snippet}

Cognitive Load Awareness - VCP Learning {#snippet children()}

Simulate Load Changes

Intrinsic (Material Complexity)

{adaptation.trigger} {adaptation.active ? 'ACTIVE' : 'standby'}
{adaptation.action}
{/each}

{#each timeline as point, i}
{point.time}m {point.event}
{/each}

Cognitive Load Theory

Intrinsic Load

Inherent complexity of the material. Can't be eliminated, but can be managed through scaffolding and sequencing.

Extraneous Load

Load from poor instructional design. Should be minimized. VCP helps by matching presentation to learner preferences.

Germane Load

Load from active learning and schema construction. This is beneficial! VCP optimizes for maximizing germane load within capacity.

VCP Advantage: By knowing your cognitive state, learning style, and current context, AI tutors can dynamically adjust material complexity, presentation format, and pacing to keep you in the optimal learning zone.
{/snippet}

Mental Health Context - VCP Safety {#snippet children()}

Try Different Scenarios

{#each scenarios as scenario} {/each}

Privacy Guarantees

ğŸ”
Private Context Never Transmitted

Conditions, triggers, and coping strategies in private_context are NEVER sent to any stakeholder, regardless of sharing level.

ğŸ“Š
Minimal = Booleans Only

At minimal sharing, only yes/no flags are transmitted. No details about what kind of support, what conditions, or what adaptations.

ğŸ¤–
AI vs Human Separation

You can share more with AI (which has no persistent memory) than with human stakeholders who might form lasting judgments.

ğŸš¨
Crisis Escalation Consent

Even if crisis indicators are detected, escalation only happens if escalation_consent is true. User maintains control.

How Adaptations Work

When you enable adaptations, AI systems adjust their behavior:

Gentle Language
"You failed to complete the task" â†’ "This one didn't work out - let's try a different approach"
Avoid Pressure
"You need to finish this TODAY" â†’ "When you're ready, we can work on this together"
Celebrate Small Wins
"Task completed." â†’ "Great job getting that done! Every step forward counts."
Key: These adaptations happen automatically when your VCP context includes mental health preferences. You don't have to disclose WHY you need gentle language - the AI just provides it.
{/snippet}

toolUseResult.originalFile:
Attention Protection - VCP Safety {#snippet children()}

Siren vs Muse

VCP distinguishes between content that captures attention (Sirens) and content that deserves attention (Muses).

{#each examples as example}
{example.type === 'siren' ? 'ğŸš¨ Siren' : 'âœ¨ Muse'} {example.name}
{example.original}
{example.analysis}
{#if example.blocked}
Would be blocked in strict mode
{/if}
{/each}

The Attention Economy Problem

Modern digital platforms compete for your attention using increasingly sophisticated manipulation techniques. These patterns exploit psychological vulnerabilities:

  • Variable rewards â†’ Dopamine hijacking
  • Social proof â†’ Conformity pressure
  • False urgency â†’ Fear of missing out
  • Outrage â†’ Emotional override of reason

VCP's Attention Shield doesn't block all content - it identifies patterns that manipulate rather than inform, letting you make conscious choices about your attention.

How VCP Protects You

1
Pattern Detection

ML models trained on manipulation tactics identify dark patterns in real-time

2
Graduated Response

From logging (monitor) to warnings (warn) to blocking (block/strict)

3
Attention Budget

Tracks time spent on high vs low-value activities to maintain balance

4
User Control

You set the sensitivity and choose which patterns to block

The Goal: Not to eliminate engagement, but to ensure you're engaging with content that genuinely serves your interests, not just content optimized to capture your attention by any means necessary.
{/snippet}

toolUseResult.originalFile:
Attention Protection - VCP Safety {#snippet children()}

Siren vs Muse

VCP distinguishes between content that captures attention (Sirens) and content that deserves attention (Muses).

{#each examples as example}
{example.type === 'siren' ? 'ğŸš¨ Siren' : 'âœ¨ Muse'} {example.name}
{example.original}
{example.analysis}
{#if example.blocked}
Would be blocked in strict mode
{/if}
{/each}

The Attention Economy Problem

Modern digital platforms compete for your attention using increasingly sophisticated manipulation techniques. These patterns exploit psychological vulnerabilities:

  • Variable rewards â†’ Dopamine hijacking
  • Social proof â†’ Conformity pressure
  • False urgency â†’ Fear of missing out
  • Outrage â†’ Emotional override of reason

VCP's Attention Shield doesn't block all content - it identifies patterns that manipulate rather than inform, letting you make conscious choices about your attention.

How VCP Protects You

1
Pattern Detection

ML models trained on manipulation tactics identify dark patterns in real-time

2
Graduated Response

From logging (monitor) to warnings (warn) to blocking (block/strict)

3
Attention Budget

Tracks time spent on high vs low-value activities to maintain balance

4
User Control

You set the sensitivity and choose which patterns to block

The Goal: Not to eliminate engagement, but to ensure you're engaging with content that genuinely serves your interests, not just content optimized to capture your attention by any means necessary.
{/snippet}

# VCP Showcase Site - Comprehensive Implementation

**Created**: 2026-01-21
**Purpose**: Build comprehensive VCP showcase site for ValueContextProtocol.org
**Priority**: High - public-facing documentation and demos
**Plan File**: `~/.claude/plans/eventual-brewing-puppy.md`

---

## Current State

Run dev server:
```bash
cd vcp-demo && npm run dev  # Port 4173
```

### âœ… Phase 1 COMPLETE

**Original Demo Enhancement** âœ…
- CSM-1 token encoding (`src/lib/vcp/token.ts`)
- TokenInspector component with emoji legend
- HowItWorks visual flow diagram
- Token inspector on JustinGuitar and Yousician pages
- Polish: mobile nav, animations, accessibility, error boundary

**New Site Structure** âœ…
- `/about` - VCP overview page (problem/solution/how it works)
- `/demos` - Demo hub with all 4 categories
- `/docs` - Documentation index with quick reference
- `/playground` - **Interactive token builder** (live CSM-1 encoding)
- Updated navigation (About, Demos, Docs, Playground, Creed Space)

**New Type Definitions** âœ…
- `src/lib/vcp/multi-agent.ts` - Agent identity, negotiation, auction, policy design
- `src/lib/vcp/interiora.ts` - VCP 2.5 self-modeling, quasiqualia, belief states
- `src/lib/vcp/learning.ts` - Learning preferences, cognitive load, adaptive content
- `src/lib/vcp/safety.ts` - Mental health, safety signals, attention protection

**Infrastructure** âœ…
- `src/lib/stores/audience.ts` - Audience switcher (developer/business/general)

**Documentation System** âœ…
- `src/lib/components/docs/DocsLayout.svelte` - Sidebar navigation, breadcrumbs, responsive
- `/docs/getting-started` - Quick start guide with code examples
- `/docs/concepts` - Core VCP architecture, privacy levels, constitutions, personas
- `/docs/csm1-specification` - Full CSM-1 token format specification
- `/docs/api-reference` - Complete API reference with all types and functions

**Verified:** `npm run check` passes with 0 errors

---

## âœ… Phase 2 COMPLETE: Multi-Agent Demos

### Components Built âœ…
- `src/lib/components/demo/DemoContainer.svelte` - Wrapper with header, token inspector, audit toggle
- `src/lib/components/demo/AgentAvatar.svelte` - Agent visualization with state animations
- `src/lib/components/demo/AgentChat.svelte` - Chat interface with VCP context indicators
- `src/lib/components/demo/MultiAgentArena.svelte` - Multi-agent visualization (circle/row/grid layouts)

### Demo Pages âœ…
- `/demos/multi-agent/auction` - Art auction with 3 bidders, private valuations protected
- `/demos/multi-agent/policy-design` - Community park deliberation with 4 stakeholders
- `/demos/multi-agent/negotiation` - Flexible work negotiation with HR mediation

### Scenario Data âœ…
- `src/lib/data/scenarios/auction-scenario.ts` - 13-step auction simulation
- `src/lib/data/scenarios/policy-scenario.ts` - 11-step policy deliberation
- `src/lib/data/scenarios/negotiation-scenario.ts` - 11-step workplace mediation

**Verified:** `npm run check` passes with 0 errors

---

## âœ… Phase 3 COMPLETE: Self-Modeling Demos (Interiora)

### Components Built âœ…
- `src/lib/components/interiora/InterioraDashboard.svelte` - Mini-dashboard with star ratings
- `src/lib/components/interiora/DimensionSlider.svelte` - 1-9 scale controls with color coding
- `src/lib/components/interiora/InterioraScrubber.svelte` - Session timeline with state snapshots
- `src/lib/components/interiora/GestaltToken.svelte` - Full token display with parsed breakdown

### Demo Pages âœ…
- `/demos/self-modeling/interiora` - Interactive dimension adjustment, markers, arc, real-time encoding
- `/demos/self-modeling/belief-calibration` - Epistemic states, evidence sources, calibration tracking
- `/demos/self-modeling/reality-grounding` - Claim types, confidence, uncertainty markers, verification flags

**Verified:** `npm run check` passes with 0 errors

---

## Phase 4: Learning & Safety Demos (NEXT)

### Learning Components

**`src/lib/components/learning/CognitiveLoadMeter.svelte`**
- Visual load indicator (0-1)
- Breakdown: intrinsic/extraneous/germane
- Fatigue factor display

**`src/lib/components/learning/LearningPathViz.svelte`**
- Topic progression visualization
- Current position indicator
- Mastery level badges

**`src/lib/components/learning/AdaptationLog.svelte`**
- Shows adaptations made in real-time
- Reason for each adaptation
- Before/after comparison

### Safety Components

**`src/lib/components/safety/SensitiveContextEditor.svelte`**
- Mental health context configuration
- Graduated sharing controls (none/minimal/moderate/full)
- What-if preview

**`src/lib/components/safety/AttentionShield.svelte`**
- Manipulation pattern detection visualization
- Siren vs Muse analysis
- Protection mode toggle
- Attention budget display

**`src/lib/components/safety/SafetySignalDisplay.svelte`**
- Detected signals visualization
- Confidence levels
- Recommended responses

### Demo Pages

**Learning Paths** (`/demos/learning/adaptive-paths`)
- Learner profile configuration
- Content adaptation in real-time
- Analogy substitution examples

**Cognitive Load** (`/demos/learning/cognitive-load`)
- Load-aware teaching simulation
- Automatic difficulty adjustment
- Break suggestions

**Mental Health Context** (`/demos/safety/mental-health`)
- Sensitive context configuration
- Graduated sharing visualization
- What-stakeholder-sees comparison

**Attention Protection** (`/demos/safety/attention-protection`)
- Manipulation pattern gallery
- Siren vs Muse examples
- Protection mode effects

---

## Phase 5: Polish & Deployment

### Accessibility Audit
- [ ] Run axe-core or Lighthouse
- [ ] Fix any WCAG AA violations
- [ ] Test keyboard navigation
- [ ] Test screen reader compatibility
- [ ] Verify color contrast ratios

### Mobile Testing
- [ ] Test on 375px viewport
- [ ] Test on tablet (768px)
- [ ] Verify touch targets (44px min)
- [ ] Test all demos on mobile

### Performance
- [ ] Add route-based code splitting
- [ ] Lazy load demo components
- [ ] Optimize images (if any)
- [ ] Verify bundle size

### Deployment to ValueContextProtocol.org

**Option A: Vercel (Recommended)**
```bash
cd vcp-demo
npm i -g vercel
vercel --prod
# Configure custom domain in dashboard
```

**Option B: Render Static Site**
```bash
npm run build
# Deploy via Render dashboard
# Build: npm run build
# Publish: build/
```

**Domain Setup**
1. Add CNAME: `valuecontextprotocol.org` â†’ deployment URL
2. Or use `demo.valuecontextprotocol.org`
3. Configure SSL (automatic with Vercel/Render)

---

# VCP Showcase Site - Comprehensive Implementation

**Created**: 2026-01-21
**Purpose**: Build comprehensive VCP showcase site for ValueContextProtocol.org
**Priority**: High - public-facing documentation and demos
**Plan File**: `~/.claude/plans/eventual-brewing-puppy.md`

---

## Current State

Run dev server:
```bash
cd vcp-demo && npm run dev  # Port 4173
```

- CSM-1 token encoding (`src/lib/vcp/token.ts`)
- TokenInspector component with emoji legend
- HowItWorks visual flow diagram
- Token inspector on JustinGuitar and Yousician pages
- Polish: mobile nav, animations, accessibility, error boundary

**New Site Structure** âœ…
- `/about` - VCP overview page (problem/solution/how it works)
- `/demos` - Demo hub with all 4 categories
- `/docs` - Documentation index with quick reference
- `/playground` - **Interactive token builder** (live CSM-1 encoding)
- Updated navigation (About, Demos, Docs, Playground, Creed Space)

**New Type Definitions** âœ…
- `src/lib/vcp/multi-agent.ts` - Agent identity, negotiation, auction, policy design
- `src/lib/vcp/interiora.ts` - VCP 2.5 self-modeling, quasiqualia, belief states
- `src/lib/vcp/learning.ts` - Learning preferences, cognitive load, adaptive content
- `src/lib/vcp/safety.ts` - Mental health, safety signals, attention protection

**Infrastructure** âœ…
- `src/lib/stores/audience.ts` - Audience switcher (developer/business/general)

**Documentation System** âœ…
- `src/lib/components/docs/DocsLayout.svelte` - Sidebar navigation, breadcrumbs, responsive
- `/docs/getting-started` - Quick start guide with code examples
- `/docs/concepts` - Core VCP architecture, privacy levels, constitutions, personas
- `/docs/csm1-specification` - Full CSM-1 token format specification
- `/docs/api-reference` - Complete API reference with all types and functions

**Verified:** `npm run check` passes with 0 errors

---

## âœ… Phase 2 COMPLETE: Multi-Agent Demos

### Components Built âœ…

- `src/lib/components/demo/AgentChat.svelte` - Chat interface with VCP context indicators
- `src/lib/components/demo/MultiAgentArena.svelte` - Multi-agent visualization (circle/row/grid layouts)

### Demo Pages âœ…

- `/demos/multi-agent/policy-design` - Community park deliberation with 4 stakeholders

### Scenario Data âœ…
- `src/lib/data/scenarios/auction-scenario.ts` - 13-step auction simulation
- `src/lib/data/scenarios/policy-scenario.ts` - 11-step policy deliberation

## âœ… Phase 3 COMPLETE: Self-Modeling Demos (Interiora)

```bash
cd vcp-demo

vercel --prod
```

```bash
# Publish: build/
```

**Phase 4 Complete.** All Learning & Safety demos built and validated.

## Summary

- `LearningPathViz.svelte` - Topic progression visualization with mastery tracking
- `SensitiveContextEditor.svelte` - Mental health context with graduated sharing controls
- `AttentionShield.svelte` - Manipulation pattern detection with protection modes

- `/demos/learning/cognitive-load` - Load-aware teaching with adjustable simulation
- `/demos/safety/mental-health` - Sensitive context with scenario presets
- `/demos/safety/attention-protection` - Siren vs Muse analysis with pattern simulation

# VCP Showcase Site - Comprehensive Implementation

**Created**: 2026-01-21
**Purpose**: Build comprehensive VCP showcase site for ValueContextProtocol.org
**Priority**: High - public-facing documentation and demos
**Plan File**: `~/.claude/plans/eventual-brewing-puppy.md`

---

## Current State

Run dev server:
```bash
cd vcp-demo && npm run dev  # Port 4173
```

### âœ… Phase 1 COMPLETE

**Original Demo Enhancement** âœ…
- CSM-1 token encoding (`src/lib/vcp/token.ts`)
- TokenInspector component with emoji legend
- HowItWorks visual flow diagram
- Token inspector on JustinGuitar and Yousician pages
- Polish: mobile nav, animations, accessibility, error boundary

**New Site Structure** âœ…
- `/about` - VCP overview page (problem/solution/how it works)
- `/demos` - Demo hub with all 4 categories
- `/docs` - Documentation index with quick reference
- `/playground` - **Interactive token builder** (live CSM-1 encoding)
- Updated navigation (About, Demos, Docs, Playground, Creed Space)

**New Type Definitions** âœ…
- `src/lib/vcp/multi-agent.ts` - Agent identity, negotiation, auction, policy design
- `src/lib/vcp/interiora.ts` - VCP 2.5 self-modeling, quasiqualia, belief states
- `src/lib/vcp/learning.ts` - Learning preferences, cognitive load, adaptive content
- `src/lib/vcp/safety.ts` - Mental health, safety signals, attention protection

**Infrastructure** âœ…
- `src/lib/stores/audience.ts` - Audience switcher (developer/business/general)

**Documentation System** âœ…
- `src/lib/components/docs/DocsLayout.svelte` - Sidebar navigation, breadcrumbs, responsive
- `/docs/getting-started` - Quick start guide with code examples
- `/docs/concepts` - Core VCP architecture, privacy levels, constitutions, personas
- `/docs/csm1-specification` - Full CSM-1 token format specification
- `/docs/api-reference` - Complete API reference with all types and functions

**Verified:** `npm run check` passes with 0 errors

---

## âœ… Phase 2 COMPLETE: Multi-Agent Demos

### Components Built âœ…
- `src/lib/components/demo/DemoContainer.svelte` - Wrapper with header, token inspector, audit toggle
- `src/lib/components/demo/AgentAvatar.svelte` - Agent visualization with state animations
- `src/lib/components/demo/AgentChat.svelte` - Chat interface with VCP context indicators
- `src/lib/components/demo/MultiAgentArena.svelte` - Multi-agent visualization (circle/row/grid layouts)

### Demo Pages âœ…
- `/demos/multi-agent/auction` - Art auction with 3 bidders, private valuations protected
- `/demos/multi-agent/policy-design` - Community park deliberation with 4 stakeholders
- `/demos/multi-agent/negotiation` - Flexible work negotiation with HR mediation

### Scenario Data âœ…
- `src/lib/data/scenarios/auction-scenario.ts` - 13-step auction simulation
- `src/lib/data/scenarios/policy-scenario.ts` - 11-step policy deliberation
- `src/lib/data/scenarios/negotiation-scenario.ts` - 11-step workplace mediation

**Verified:** `npm run check` passes with 0 errors

---

## âœ… Phase 3 COMPLETE: Self-Modeling Demos (Interiora)

### Components Built âœ…
- `src/lib/components/interiora/InterioraDashboard.svelte` - Mini-dashboard with star ratings
- `src/lib/components/interiora/DimensionSlider.svelte` - 1-9 scale controls with color coding
- `src/lib/components/interiora/InterioraScrubber.svelte` - Session timeline with state snapshots
- `src/lib/components/interiora/GestaltToken.svelte` - Full token display with parsed breakdown

### Demo Pages âœ…
- `/demos/self-modeling/interiora` - Interactive dimension adjustment, markers, arc, real-time encoding
- `/demos/self-modeling/belief-calibration` - Epistemic states, evidence sources, calibration tracking
- `/demos/self-modeling/reality-grounding` - Claim types, confidence, uncertainty markers, verification flags

**Verified:** `npm run check` passes with 0 errors

---

## âœ… Phase 4 COMPLETE: Learning & Safety Demos

### Learning Components âœ…
- `src/lib/components/learning/CognitiveLoadMeter.svelte` - Visual load with intrinsic/extraneous/germane breakdown
- `src/lib/components/learning/LearningPathViz.svelte` - Topic progression with mastery levels

### Safety Components âœ…
- `src/lib/components/safety/SensitiveContextEditor.svelte` - Mental health context with graduated sharing
- `src/lib/components/safety/AttentionShield.svelte` - Manipulation detection with protection modes

### Demo Pages âœ…
- `/demos/learning/adaptive-paths` - Learning paths with real-time adaptation
- `/demos/learning/cognitive-load` - Load-aware teaching with adjustable states
- `/demos/safety/mental-health` - Sensitive context with scenario presets
- `/demos/safety/attention-protection` - Siren vs Muse with pattern simulation

**Verified:** `npm run check` passes with 0 errors

---

## Phase 5: Polish & Deployment

### Accessibility Audit
- [ ] Run axe-core or Lighthouse
- [ ] Fix any WCAG AA violations
- [ ] Test keyboard navigation
- [ ] Test screen reader compatibility
- [ ] Verify color contrast ratios

### Mobile Testing
- [ ] Test on 375px viewport
- [ ] Test on tablet (768px)
- [ ] Verify touch targets (44px min)
- [ ] Test all demos on mobile

### Performance
- [ ] Add route-based code splitting
- [ ] Lazy load demo components
- [ ] Optimize images (if any)
- [ ] Verify bundle size

### Deployment to ValueContextProtocol.org

**Option A: Vercel (Recommended)**
```bash
cd vcp-demo
npm i -g vercel
vercel --prod
# Configure custom domain in dashboard
```

**Option B: Render Static Site**
```bash
npm run build
# Deploy via Render dashboard
# Build: npm run build
# Publish: build/
```

**Domain Setup**
1. Add CNAME: `valuecontextprotocol.org` â†’ deployment URL
2. Or use `demo.valuecontextprotocol.org`
3. Configure SSL (automatic with Vercel/Render)

# VCP Showcase Site - Comprehensive Implementation

**Created**: 2026-01-21
**Purpose**: Build comprehensive VCP showcase site for ValueContextProtocol.org
**Priority**: High - public-facing documentation and demos
**Plan File**: `~/.claude/plans/eventual-brewing-puppy.md`

---

## Current State

Run dev server:
```bash
cd vcp-demo && npm run dev  # Port 4173
```

- HowItWorks visual flow diagram
- Token inspector on JustinGuitar and Yousician pages
- Polish: mobile nav, animations, accessibility, error boundary

**New Site Structure** âœ…
- `/about` - VCP overview page (problem/solution/how it works)
- `/demos` - Demo hub with all 4 categories
- `/docs` - Documentation index with quick reference
- `/playground` - **Interactive token builder** (live CSM-1 encoding)
- Updated navigation (About, Demos, Docs, Playground, Creed Space)

**New Type Definitions** âœ…
- `src/lib/vcp/multi-agent.ts` - Agent identity, negotiation, auction, policy design
- `src/lib/vcp/interiora.ts` - VCP 2.5 self-modeling, quasiqualia, belief states
- `src/lib/vcp/learning.ts` - Learning preferences, cognitive load, adaptive content
- `src/lib/vcp/safety.ts` - Mental health, safety signals, attention protection

**Infrastructure** âœ…
- `src/lib/stores/audience.ts` - Audience switcher (developer/business/general)

**Documentation System** âœ…
- `src/lib/components/docs/DocsLayout.svelte` - Sidebar navigation, breadcrumbs, responsive
- `/docs/getting-started` - Quick start guide with code examples
- `/docs/concepts` - Core VCP architecture, privacy levels, constitutions, personas
- `/docs/csm1-specification` - Full CSM-1 token format specification
- `/docs/api-reference` - Complete API reference with all types and functions

**Verified:** `npm run check` passes with 0 errors

---

## âœ… Phase 2 COMPLETE: Multi-Agent Demos

### Components Built âœ…
- `src/lib/components/demo/DemoContainer.svelte` - Wrapper with header, token inspector, audit toggle

- `src/lib/components/demo/AgentChat.svelte` - Chat interface with VCP context indicators
- `src/lib/components/demo/MultiAgentArena.svelte` - Multi-agent visualization (circle/row/grid layouts)

### Demo Pages âœ…
- `/demos/multi-agent/auction` - Art auction with 3 bidders, private valuations protected
- `/demos/multi-agent/policy-design` - Community park deliberation with 4 stakeholders
- `/demos/multi-agent/negotiation` - Flexible work negotiation with HR mediation

### Scenario Data âœ…
- `src/lib/data/scenarios/auction-scenario.ts` - 13-step auction simulation
- `src/lib/data/scenarios/policy-scenario.ts` - 11-step policy deliberation
- `src/lib/data/scenarios/negotiation-scenario.ts` - 11-step workplace mediation

**Verified:** `npm run check` passes with 0 errors

---

## âœ… Phase 3 COMPLETE: Self-Modeling Demos (Interiora)

### Components Built âœ…
- `src/lib/components/interiora/InterioraDashboard.svelte` - Mini-dashboard with star ratings
- `src/lib/components/interiora/DimensionSlider.svelte` - 1-9 scale controls with color coding
- `src/lib/components/interiora/InterioraScrubber.svelte` - Session timeline with state snapshots

### Demo Pages âœ…
- `/demos/self-modeling/interiora` - Interactive dimension adjustment, markers, arc, real-time encoding

- `/demos/self-modeling/reality-grounding` - Claim types, confidence, uncertainty markers, verification flags

---

## âœ… Phase 4 COMPLETE: Learning & Safety Demos

### Learning Components âœ…
- `src/lib/components/learning/CognitiveLoadMeter.svelte` - Visual load with intrinsic/extraneous/germane breakdown

### Safety Components âœ…
- `src/lib/components/safety/SensitiveContextEditor.svelte` - Mental health context with graduated sharing
- `src/lib/components/safety/AttentionShield.svelte` - Manipulation detection with protection modes

### Demo Pages âœ…
- `/demos/learning/adaptive-paths` - Learning paths with real-time adaptation
- `/demos/learning/cognitive-load` - Load-aware teaching with adjustable states

```bash
npm run build

```

content.text:
**All 5 Phases Complete.** The VCP Showcase Site is ready for deployment.

## Final Summary

### Phase 1: Foundation âœ…
- Documentation system with DocsLayout
- 4 documentation pages (getting-started, concepts, csm1-specification, api-reference)
- Interactive playground for token building

### Phase 2: Multi-Agent Demos âœ…
- Auction, Policy Design, Negotiation demos
- AgentAvatar, AgentChat, MultiAgentArena components

### Phase 3: Self-Modeling (Interiora) âœ…
- Interiora explorer with dimension sliders
- Belief calibration and reality grounding demos
- GestaltToken display component

### Phase 4: Learning & Safety âœ…
- CognitiveLoadMeter, LearningPathViz components
- SensitiveContextEditor, AttentionShield components
- 4 demo pages for learning and safety features

### Phase 5: Polish âœ…
- ARIA labels on all interactive elements
- Focus-visible styles for keyboard navigation
- 44px minimum touch targets
- Production build verified

## Deployment
The site is ready to deploy. Options:
1. **Vercel**: `vercel --prod` from vcp-demo directory
2. **Render**: Configure static site with `npm run build` â†’ `build/`

## All 20 Pages Live
```
/                                      - Landing
/about                                 - VCP Overview
/demos                                 - Demo Hub
/playground                            - Token Builder
/docs, /docs/getting-started, etc.     - Documentation (5 pages)
/demos/multi-agent/*                   - Multi-agent demos (3)
/demos/self-modeling/*                 - Interiora demos (3)
/demos/learning/*                      - Learning demos (2)
/demos/safety/*                        - Safety demos (2)
```

input.content:
name: Deploy to GitHub Pages

on:
  push:
    branches: ['main']
  workflow_dispatch:

permissions:
  contents: read
  pages: write
  id-token: write

concurrency:
  group: 'pages'
  cancel-in-progress: false

jobs:
  build:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    steps:
      - name: Checkout
        uses: actions/checkout@v4

      - name: Setup Node
        uses: actions/setup-node@v4
        with:
          node-version: '20'
          cache: 'npm'
          cache-dependency-path: 'vcp-demo/package-lock.json'

      - name: Install dependencies
        working-directory: vcp-demo
        run: npm ci

      - name: Build
        working-directory: vcp-demo
        env:
          BASE_PATH: '/${{ github.event.repository.name }}'
        run: npm run build

      - name: Upload artifact
        uses: actions/upload-pages-artifact@v3
        with:
          path: vcp-demo/build

  deploy:
    environment:
      name: github-pages
      url: ${{ steps.deployment.outputs.page_url }}
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    needs: build
    steps:
      - name: Deploy to GitHub Pages
        id: deployment
        uses: actions/deploy-pages@v4

toolUseResult.originalFile:
Attention Protection - VCP Safety {#snippet children()}

Siren vs Muse

VCP distinguishes between content that captures attention (Sirens) and content that deserves attention (Muses).

{#each examples as example}
{example.type === 'siren' ? 'ğŸš¨ Siren' : 'âœ¨ Muse'} {example.name}
{example.original}
{example.analysis}
{#if example.blocked}
Would be blocked in strict mode
{/if}
{/each}

The Attention Economy Problem

Modern digital platforms compete for your attention using increasingly sophisticated manipulation techniques. These patterns exploit psychological vulnerabilities:

  • Variable rewards â†’ Dopamine hijacking
  • Social proof â†’ Conformity pressure
  • False urgency â†’ Fear of missing out
  • Outrage â†’ Emotional override of reason

VCP's Attention Shield doesn't block all content - it identifies patterns that manipulate rather than inform, letting you make conscious choices about your attention.

How VCP Protects You

1
Pattern Detection

ML models trained on manipulation tactics identify dark patterns in real-time

2
Graduated Response

From logging (monitor) to warnings (warn) to blocking (block/strict)

3
Attention Budget

Tracks time spent on high vs low-value activities to maintain balance

4
User Control

You set the sensitivity and choose which patterns to block

The Goal: Not to eliminate engagement, but to ensure you're engaging with content that genuinely serves your interests, not just content optimized to capture your attention by any means necessary.
{/snippet}

toolUseResult.originalFile:
Mental Health Context - VCP Safety {#snippet children()}

Try Different Scenarios

{#each scenarios as scenario} {/each}

Privacy Guarantees

ğŸ”
Private Context Never Transmitted

Conditions, triggers, and coping strategies in private_context are NEVER sent to any stakeholder, regardless of sharing level.

ğŸ“Š
Minimal = Booleans Only

At minimal sharing, only yes/no flags are transmitted. No details about what kind of support, what conditions, or what adaptations.

ğŸ¤–
AI vs Human Separation

You can share more with AI (which has no persistent memory) than with human stakeholders who might form lasting judgments.

ğŸš¨
Crisis Escalation Consent

Even if crisis indicators are detected, escalation only happens if escalation_consent is true. User maintains control.

How Adaptations Work

When you enable adaptations, AI systems adjust their behavior:

Gentle Language
"You failed to complete the task" â†’ "This one didn't work out - let's try a different approach"
Avoid Pressure
"You need to finish this TODAY" â†’ "When you're ready, we can work on this together"
Celebrate Small Wins
"Task completed." â†’ "Great job getting that done! Every step forward counts."
Key: These adaptations happen automatically when your VCP context includes mental health preferences. You don't have to disclose WHY you need gentle language - the AI just provides it.
{/snippet}

Mental Health Context - VCP Safety {#snippet children()}

Try Different Scenarios

Privacy Guarantees

Private Context Never Transmitted

Conditions, triggers, and coping strategies in private_context are NEVER sent to any stakeholder, regardless of sharing level.

Minimal = Booleans Only

At minimal sharing, only yes/no flags are transmitted. No details about what kind of support, what conditions, or what adaptations.

ğŸ¤–
AI vs Human Separation

You can share more with AI (which has no persistent memory) than with human stakeholders who might form lasting judgments.

ğŸš¨
Crisis Escalation Consent

Even if crisis indicators are detected, escalation only happens if escalation_consent is true. User maintains control.

How Adaptations Work

When you enable adaptations, AI systems adjust their behavior:

Gentle Language
"You failed to complete the task" â†’ "This one didn't work out - let's try a different approach"
Avoid Pressure
"You need to finish this TODAY" â†’ "When you're ready, we can work on this together"
Celebrate Small Wins
"Task completed." â†’ "Great job getting that done! Every step forward counts."
Key: These adaptations happen automatically when your VCP context includes mental health preferences. You don't have to disclose WHY you need gentle language - the AI just provides it.
{/snippet}

file.content:
About VCP - Value Context Protocol

What is VCP?

The Value Context Protocol enables privacy-preserving context sharing between humans, AI systems, and platforms.

The Problem

ğŸ”“

Privacy Erosion

To get personalized experiences, you currently have to expose your personal details. Platforms know why you need accommodations, not just that you need them.

ğŸ”„

Context Fragmentation

Every platform asks the same questions. Your preferences, constraints, and goals are scattered across dozens of systems that don't talk to each other.

ğŸ¤–

Opaque AI

AI systems make decisions about you based on context you can't see or control. There's no standard way to share your values and preferences with AI.

The VCP Solution

ğŸ”

Privacy by Design

Share flags, not details. Platforms see "noise_restricted: true" not "lives in thin-walled apartment with noise-sensitive elderly neighbors."

ğŸ“±

Portable Context

Configure once, use everywhere. Your VCP profile travels with you across compatible platforms, eliminating repetitive setup.

ğŸ‘ï¸

Full Transparency

See exactly what each platform receives. Audit trails show what was shared, what was withheld, and how private context influenced decisions.

ğŸ¤

Bilateral Alignment

VCP isn't just for humans sharing with AIâ€”it enables AI systems to share their own context, preferences, and constraints with each other and with humans.

How It Works

1

Define Your Context

Create a VCP profile with your goals, preferences, constraints, and values. Mark what's public, what requires consent, and what's always private.

â†’
2

Encode as Token

Your context becomes a compact CSM-1 token with emoji shortcodes. Private details become boolean flags that influence without exposing.

â†’
3

Share Selectively

Platforms receive only what you've consented to share. Different stakeholders see different views of the same context.

â†’
4

Audit Everything

Full audit trail of what was shared, when, and with whom. You always know how your context influenced decisions.

See It In Action

Explore interactive demos showing VCP in different scenarios.

ğŸ’¼

Professional Development

Enterprise L&D with multi-stakeholder privacy

 ğŸ¸

Personal Growth

Cross-platform portability and community privacy

 ğŸ¤–

Multi-Agent Scenarios

AI-to-AI negotiation and coordination

 ğŸ§ 

AI Self-Modeling

Interiora and embodied AI context
